A bit of a controversial review, but this is my opinion.
This game is NOT worth 60 euros, it's worth at most 20 (I bought it on sale for 10 euros).
Battlefield 2042 isn't a perfect game and it's not terrible as it was at the time of release, I've played almost 100 hours and this is what I can say.
It's a game that's fun to play, I love that it's a sandbox. You can literally think of anything and do it, if you want to kill someone by jumping out of an airplane and shooting an RPG at another airplane and then climbing back into your plane, go for it! If you want to make a kill with a sniper rifle with a range of a kilometer, go for it! You can even make a fpv drone, just put a c5 on the drone and fly it to the enemy or to the vehicle, and then press the explosion button and that's it, I really like it because you have freedom of action and can play as you want and enjoy the sandbox. 
And also a very cool feature is that you can change weapon attachments during the match, it's incredibly convenient, your weapon becomes more situational, that is, you can have an assault rifle, partly a machine gun and partly a DMR in your hands at the same time, it's cool, it adds more options.

But there are also disadvantages.
- I did not encounter a large number of bugs, but they were there, the most frequent was the black screen bug, every time you need to restart the game.
- The explosion system is not realistic at all. 
Literally a few meters from the enemy, an RPG charge, a G-84 TGM or mortar charge arrives - 0 damage or just a little bit, it's absolutely not realistic.
- The game is monotonous, you fight either for the US or ruzzia in the future war, that's all. I expected a lot more from the game, more weapons, equipment, too few weapons for a game about a future war.
- Vehicles in the game are not balanced and bad to drive (driven like a toy, not a realistic multi-ton vehicle). Players use tanks far away from the battles, because if they get too close, literally everyone will blow up your tank in half a second.
- It's very funny that the game doesn't have all chat, it's just stpid.
- there is no server browsing in the game, it's shocking how stpid it is, when you enter a match, you can be 1/64 or 1/128 and you have to leave, but when you look for a match again you are thrown into the same one and you either have to wait or pause and look for a match again, + due to the lack of online in the game and because there are literally no server browsing in every game you are playing with +-15 AI
- THEY DIDN'T ADD PLAYER DEATHS TO THE SCOREBOARD, IT'S JUST RIDICULOUS.
- It's just insolence to add battlepass to this game.
- There are less cheaters in battlefield 1 than in battlefield 2042 
- I've never liked EA because it's a greedy company, its goal is just to get as much money from you as possible, not to give you a cool and interesting game, without microtransactions and other sht.
+- Most of the maps are interesting and fun to play, but there are also some completely boring ones (manifest, hourglass)  
- This game is more like call of duty than battlefield.
- This game has two game modes. That's it. They just took away some of the really cool game modes from the previous parts and just added modes that no one plays, lmao.

So, if you really want to play a good game, then buy Battlefield 1, I can give this game a maximum of 7/10, this game is not for everyone, it's fun, but it's made by people who don't care about the players opinion

If your looking for a proper Battlefield experience, play Battlefield 4 instead. I, like many others, got absolutely robbed by Dice's nostalgia bating marketing campaign and so immediately pre-ordered 2042 without hesitating. Over the years some improvements have been made but the game still feels soulless. The maps, whilst receiving some reworks, are still far too vast. The weather events are still useless gimmicks. The weapon is roster far too basic: Especially when compared to the countless weapons available to you in past Battlefield titles. Classes don't feel diverse anymore, you can have your cake and eat it. Many unlock-able weapons are transferable across classes in which they don't belong. Battlefield Portal was supposed to be a saving grace of Battlefield 2042 but it was less than half baked. Tools for portal server owners remain scarce. Overall a bit of a disappointment. The game-play doesn't live up to the grand scale standards that Dice advertised in 2021 even after 2 years.

A technically badly made game.

They fixed most of the stupid nonsense that shipped with the game on launch. If you can get it for $20 on sale, it's a great deal and provides the same enjoyable stuff from BF4 and BF3 of old, plus some new objective-based gameplay. Battle pass is totally optional, as are the cosmetics. That said, Battle Pass will run you about $20 in coins and you'll make around half of that back as you progress the pass. Up to you if that's worth your time, otherwise you can just progress the free track.

What sucks? UI is pretty busy with all the gadgets and abilities in game. There's not a real strong differentiation between "heroes" as opposed to class specializations. Unlocking weapon attachments takes a long time, but that's not too different than Battlefields of old.

Definitely worth a pick up nowadays if you're looking for a new shooter to play. Wait for it to go on sale, and toss the developers a few bucks in cosmetics or for the Battle Pass if you had a good time.

It can be a lot of fun or frustrating depending on how you play it, but that also goes for many other games.

I wouldn't say it deserves the hate that it still gets today, since the devs have been going around fixing stuff, like, I could barely play the game when I bought it without being greeted by our beloved black screen after almost every match, and without lagging a lot.

It's a bit disappointing that there's no campaign mode. For me, getting all the campaign achievements in battlefield titles is still a lot of fun, so I wish it had one.

It's also disappointing how you can only get a few weapons if you buy premium, but previous battlefield titles did the same thing. Another thing is how you can easily climb up to the top 5 on the scoreboard by just healing and reviving your team, because very few people do it, and if you die, even if there's several supports near you, you probably won't get revived and bleed out. Not even squad members will revive you most of the time.

And also, I used to get the classic black screen all the time but I think it has finally been fixed after 2 years, because I haven't seen it in a while.

But even with all that, I still think it's a good game and going around healing and reviving people while world crumbles around you is a lot of fun.

Got it for 15 dollars and I think it's pretty fun! I think Battlefield, in a lot of ways, fails to really keep up with modern multiplayer video games. Everything is F2P, everything constantly tries to lock you in with aggressive FOMO tactics (which this game vaguely tries with a Battle Pass but it's not very good), and everything goes for crossover appeal and crazy, insane guest appearances. Battlefield as a series has never really done that, and it feels the same as it ever was after it's patches. HOWEVER, I'm a fan of Battlefield's standard, and now that it's a functional video game, I think this is really solid. The sweet spot for a purchase is probably around the ~$25 range I'd think. It's fun, crossplay keeps the game populated, and it's BF3-BF5 Battlefield gameplay as you remember it. Whether nostalgia will still allow that gameplay to satisfy you is gonna be a very personal experience.

We all know this game is bad... but why?
Music- Remember in Bf4 when you won or lost  a match how that cool soundtrack would play? The music in this game is not that. It's fucking bad. 

Maps- The maps have potential, the graphics are pretty good and the buildings are ok. But they are completely bare. It's like they gave up halfway when making some of them. Why didn't they at least copy paste some more buildings. There's this one map in particular that stands out and represents everything wrong with the game. It's a conquest map that's divided into 2 zones, one with solar panels or some shit and the other with grass and like 3 buildings. That's it........ The map is so small compared to maps in bf4 and yet they still manage to have so much open space. Maps in this game are              S O U L L E S S 

Gameplay- Jets feel really gay and don't feel as powerful and as fast as bf4 but that's just me. Gunplay is nice in 2042 compared to bf4 where you're shaking around and having a seizure when run and gunning. Movement is pretty good.

Destruction- I don't care for levolutions but they're ass in this game especially when these devs are literally using frostbite. (then again everyone who knew how to use frostbite left the studio) Regular destruction for buildings is just meh. If you play The Finals you can see where all that talent went. (finals has nice destruction but its also a boring ish game)

I am a 55 year old biker and trucker father, and probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 15 now. My son got this game for from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 12 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he let me borrow his controller. Me and my son then played in turns and I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

Really bad experience past the level 30. Payed ~10 bucks for the game in the Christmas sale and I regret it.

Main issues with the game.
1. Map design is bad, and most of each map is cut off killing you if you go outside the zones, its stupid and makes flanking almost impossible against decent players.
2. SBMM is horrible, there are players making new accounts which clearly have a lot of hours into the game.
3. Every class can shoot from afar with almost any gun and have access to very long scopes.
4. Marking players and their position is a completely broken mechanic, especially when someone dies can still mark the player that kill him, I cannot think of a single reason as to why this mechanic is even in the battlefield games except to force a k/d=1 if you are decent.
5. Vehicles are overpower and are used more as snipers than anything else, rockets are under power. The mechanic class is a joke.
6. The scope glint another stupid mechanic.
7. Soldier class passive ability can stack with vehicles, for example the character that when you shoot him  reveals your location, stacks when driving a tank. So if you shoot the tank your location is revel. Moreover, players in tanks have complete song awareness when soldiers approximate the tanks making c5 explosives virtually useless. 
8. Who thinks a vehicle with fast mobility, thick armor and which can be used to attack players by the driver himself was a good idea.
9. At this point I am certain that the people that make the decision for the games, do not play the games enough to have a good understanding of why certain mechanics should not be in the game. 
10. Aim assist in this game feels really strong, the aim slow down so much even when the aim is not even close to the target and sure you can tune it down but then are at a disadvantage.
11. In terms of learning curve, the game has a low floor and also low ceiling. A 5 minutes search in youtube tell you exactly what are the broken weapons, characters and vehicles and that is all you need.
12. If battlefield 1 was a secure game to play, It will be ideal. Now that was a good game.

Overall score 2/10.
in case you were wondering, still easily the worst shooter to come out of this company

HOLY SHIT WHAT AN EPIC GAME!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I've been playing this game with my dad and we've always had a wonderful father and son experience while playing it. I do enjoy playing this game by self too since this game's movement and the different playstyles are great. I highly recommend anyone buying this for €9.99 however I don't really think it's worth getting for €59.99.

Game feels like Warzone if it had a conquest mode. Don't look for the traditional BF experience you know from the base game. Portal is the saving grace right now, but like the base game, it also lacks in guns, maps, etc.

Not to forget the insane amount of bugs and missing features. I don't recommend buying this game at all in it's current state, wait a few months to a year when DICE LA fixes it, and for it to be on sale.

edit: It's 1-20-24, the last year or so of updates have for sure made it a better game, but it still doesn't hold a candle in terms of overall gameplay, etc. to BC2, BF3, or BF4.

This franchise is still one of my all time favorites but needs to get back to its roots in terms of game play fundamentals.

My biggest grips is silly but the fact that is you have a fast SSD alt+F4 and relaunching the game is the fastest way to get into another match is ridiculous. The end game player achievement animations are silly that you can't skip them.

You cant do much about the teams you get but be expected to a either roll the other team or get rolled. While the game isn't as bad as BF V expect a lot of players with "synthetic" skill.

*edit Nov 1, 2023 - this new update has brought back the input lag spikes. Seems to have been fixed.

*edit Nov 6, 2023 - The game has seen a big uptick in cheaters. Not sure what is going on but EA cant detect them so they are having free reign. Most players try and hide it but lately there has been a large uptick in people who don't care and kill entire teams is seconds. EA used to send emails to people when you reported a cheater and they banned them but they either are not banning or they quit letting you know your input mattered. FML

*edit Jan 20, 2024 - The game is still a cheat fest and you will either win by a mile of get destroyed by a mile due to blatant cheaters being on or against you. There is virtually no close call if you play in Asia from my experience. I don't hate the game but it does feel more like BF:V more and more every day (cheats are the norm).

Battlefield 2042 is probably the worst battlefield game in the series. It doesn't really even feel like a Battlefield game, but it's a decent game that can be fun for a bit. I genuinely don't know how I have put 300 hours into this game.
Even the worst Battlefield games have some redeeming qualities and things I want to return in the next game. Battlefield 2042 does not have anything I want to return in future titles. Mostly because everything in this game is just worse than previous games, but also the few new things like the Plus and Call In systems sound cool on paper but end up being really broken in practice.
The game also runs quite bad. For example, on my machine Battlefield 1 @ native 1440p Ultra runs at 170+ fps. Battlefield V runs @ native 1440p at 150+ fps. Battlefield 2042 runs at DLSS 1440p (effectively 1080p) ALL LOW Settings gets me  maybe 120 FPS if things are calm, consistently drops into the 80s and 90s. I have a Ryzen 7 5800x, 32gb ram, and a 3060ti for reference.
I would not recommend buying the game unless its ~$10 or less.
The game is fun. It seems like Dice is starting to figure things out. However, I only paid $20 for the game and I DO NOT suggest paying full price.

This game is full of cinematic and artistic imagination with potential for some seriously fun gameplay. It just feels like garbage, Movement is terrible unless you are using a grapple or a squirrel suit. This studio nailed it with fun gadgets and artistic designs but I don't think they know what they are doing when it comes to quality combat that feels solid and reliable. I still can't find a go to loadout to this day. Nothing in the weapon inventory feels like that go to fun experience because the gameplay isn't a quality, consistent experience. This studio has created their own BF niche somehow and a lot of people love it but it isn't because of quality gunplay and movement I know that. 

I think this games future will show itself in a whole new light when they start releasing a BF2042 compaign but as far as MP goes it is not the quality BF experience.
If you get it on sale, I'd say its worth it. Feels like a modernised yet less polished BF4.

edit: 19/01/24

I reinstalled BF2042 since a couple of my mates were going to giving it a second go after the shocking launch. This time around the game wont even open. After lots of looking online I have:

1. Checked for missing or damaged files
2. Reinstalled the anticheat
3. Gave all the programs elevated privileges
4. Ran the exe as admin directly
5. Disabled all antivirus and firewalls
6. Restarted my PC

Short of reinstalling the whole game I'm not sure what else I'm meant to do since all the YouTube videos either tell me to do the above or to update my drivers which are all up to date anyway.

I felt robbed when I first bought into this trainwreck. The bugs, the lack of content, the poor balance etc etc. Now I feel robbed again when the game I paid a considerable amount of money for won't even launch, won't give me an error to troubleshoot and doesn't seem to have any obvious cause or solution. 

I would regard battlefield 3 and 4 as two of my favourite games of all time but it's clear to see that the era of great battlefield games is long behind us. Made especially apparent by the fact a 3 man dev team can deliver a more fun and authentic feeling "battlefield" experience than a company worth 10's of Billions.

I have now

Reviewing this game is all about context. This game has been out for over 2 years and it plays like a semi-poor release. If it had JUST released, sure, it's pretty good. But two years later and they're still experiencing bad class design, mediocre gun play for all but like 3 guns, and the most unbearable of all - the matchmaking. 

I could not stress enough in a review how horrendous this matchmaking is. Half the time, the match fills with AI; the other half of the time, the matches are insanely one-sided. The fact that this game is still $60 blows my mind. My recommendation: Only buy it at a heavy discount, I would spend $30 at most on it. This is after having played it for over 100 hours.

This is a mistreated game. And by explaining this, I want to do it some justice in my personal opinion. I am a massive BF fan who has been playing since Bad Company 2, and I was a total veteran on BF3. Seeing this game release with so many issues did bother me, of course, and like everyone else I was tempted to stay away from it due to all the negative reviews it had received. I finally said... Screw it, and I bought myself a copy of the game on sale, and I waited a while to play it, and I was surprised how much fun I had and how much I actually loved it. It has become a common problem these days for developers to release games that need more time to be worked out, Just like this one. I waited a few years for this game to receive the patches and work it needed before playing it, and I will say that I am far from disappointed. A common problem in the entire gaming community is that everyone Overly judges games today, and very harshly, especially ones that grow to fix their issues and become great games. I will say this, There is no such thing as a truly bad game, and it only truly depends on whether or not you like it and enjoy it, IT all matters on YOU, your opinions, your feelings, and how well you take it and or enjoy it. Do not EVER let the weight of reviews and media affect your views on games, movies, or anything else for that matter. Try these things for yourself and see if YOU like it, because in the end, that is all that matters. Developers can be lazy, yes. Developers can be careless, yes. Developers can be Money hungry, Of course. All that I am saying overall, is To not judge a book by it's cover. And I would say to Try 2042 out, you'd be surprised how much you may or may not like it. I came to realize such a "bad" game had many many players on it, which I found Ironic. I love this game, and I at least appreciate the effort put into making it better, despite their laziness they put into it upon release.
Way better than it was at launch.

Every other BF game runs perfectly fine on my computer so it's not a hardware issue. Typical EA/DICE buggy game. Don't recommend.

To simplify the review, the game has come a long way since release and if you already have it in your library, give it another go. If you are a new buyer, snag it up on sale but its finally feeling like battlefield.

Battlefield 2042 delivers a compelling gaming experience with refined and engaging infantry-only modes, showcasing impressive gameplay mechanics. However, the game falls short in the map department, lacking the immersive depth seen in previous Battlefield titles. While the intense and tactical nature of infantry-focused modes stands out, the overall essence of the traditional large-scale battles that define the series seems compromised. Despite these shortcomings, when the game is on sale, the addictive infantry gameplay and refined mechanics make it definitely worth the purchase. The developers have done a commendable job refining the game into a good FPS shooter, even though it deviates from some expectations associated with the Battlefield franchise. 7.5/10

I've been playing this series since Bad Company 2. We already know DICE fixes bugs after release and we all know all series launched buggy. However, there is a structural problem here, the architecture of the maps is wrong, the spawn points are problematic. Hovercrafts are insane and There are problems such as netcode hitreg, there is not even a simple scoreboard at the bottom. Guys don't mind this unfinished game until it's complete. if you're very keen, try it for 10 hours with gamepass or ea play.

TR: Yaklaşık 10 senemi bu seriye vermiş insanım hatta daha fazladır. Bad Company 2'den beri oynuyorum.

Hatalar glitchler elbette eksi ama maalesef alışığız DICE fixler. Ancak burada bir yapısal sorun var haritaların mimarisi yanlış spawn noktaları sorunlu netcode hitreg gibi problemler var yahu alt tarafı basit bir scoreboard bile yok. Arkadaşlar bu bitmemiş bir oyun bitene kadar da almayın aldırmayın çok istekliyseniz gamepass veya ea play ile 10 saat deneyin zaten optimizasyon sorunlarına da değinmiyorum. This game has A LOT of potential, as somebody who has played since Battlefield 3 (and i have played a lot of 2142 in the 2010s) I have to say that this game is not at all terrible. The guns feel amazing to shoot and features like changing attachments while in the field is such a awesome addition. I love the Modern / Futuristic setting of the game too. Portal mode is also really awesome, Playing Caspian Border in 2042 brings back so much memories of playing Battlefield 3.

There are issues such as whenever i launch the game the EA Client / Application gives me shit and i have to launch the game 2-4 times for it in order to work. I have not experienced any sorts of crashes or optimization issues too. Another issue but its a personal one is the operators or heroes or whatever because it doesnt really make sense in a 128 player game.

Overall i do think this game is more positive than negative, the outcome of this game gives me hope that the next Battlefield will be even better and hopefully DICE will be able to finally catch up to COD again

No one uses their brain and it feels like its gotten even worse each edition of the game. I think this is the last Battlefield for me to have bought. Certain maps made for other games are shoehorned in without consideration for the bucket load of new mechanics which ultimately break the game further. Theres just so many poor choices in the game design. Real shame.

I have been playing Battlefield since BF2. Have played it on almost every platform - Xbox 360, Xbox One, PS4, PC.

And BF2042 has had to be the biggest flop they have released. They are a Triple-A game but released something worse than an Early Access game - even though they had an open beta.

Aside from the fact the game was COMPLETELY for months after release, it has turned into something a battlefield game should never be. Not only do they keep changing core-mechanics of the game, the ENTIRE meta has been changing along with it.

Are you looking for a Battlefield game where you can just hop back into multiplayer and play after taking a break? (this is how I've always played battlefield) If so, you may find it harder than anticipated. In my eyes, it has turned into a bastardized RPG.

Choose your specialist, pick your favorite ability! Oh, but now you will only gain certain bonuses from specific classes of weapons that you use. And your equipment/gadgets should directly support your specialists' ability - changing every time you switch specialists.

There is a lot I can say, but you'll need to intimately understand every mechanic in this game. Understanding the mechanics will take a decent amount of hours. Once you do, you'll need to figure out how to counter certain things - except you can't unless you have a good squad or two on the team. Team balancing has been a pretty big issue.

And just as you learn everything, there is a new update which overhauls most mechanics. Leaving you figuring it all out over again.

TLDR; BF2042 has turned into some unrecognizable RPG game with a much sharper learning curve compared to their previous titles. Since the horrendous release, game play mechanics have been continuously reworked which make it over-complicated. The only pro is that the game is finally playable.

Will be sticking to BF1 for now.

I quit playing this game about two years ago because of the glitchy mess it was at the time. I decided to return about a month ago to see if it had improved. When you can find a clean lobby with honest players it is much better than it was then and can be quite fun at times.

Unfortunately, the game is plagued with hackers who use aimbots, wallhacks, and endless magazines to ruin everyone's fun as evidenced by their random number user names, default skins, unrealistic levels for playtime, etc. For this reason, I cannot recommend this game to anyone. In many ways, it is still a downgrade from previous Battlefield titles. Even without the hacking issues, several game modes have game breaking balancing issues such as light armored cars and helicopters with more armor than tanks. In one mode, Breakout, the attacking faction typically has four or more armored vehicles to the defenders one to two. There is also very little building damage or destruction compared to previous titles.

I would recommend buying a previous Battlefield title over this.

This was really fun game till few months ago. I was playing it since it got bad hoping that DICE will make it good again, but it was useless wait. 
Matchmaking in this game is awful right now. Most likely due to constant loss of good players last few months, you have a chance to constantly end in teams that are full of bad players with negative KD and no interest in playing the game objective. There are few players that are trying, but it is just not enough. If you do get in better team, games are often short with unsatisfying win. Rarely you get in the game with balanced teams and fun game experience. 
Developers did in the past years nerf any weapon that can threaten air vehicles, and destroying the plane or heli with ground troop is difficult. Short range and slow turn radius of guided missiles and short aim range for automatic missiles makes air vehicles OP in this game. 
There are some cheaters in the game. Some are easy identified, and some are smarter and try to hide their cheating. If I identify player using a cheat, or suspecting the player is using the cheat due to several suspecting plays, I report it ingame. Never did I get any feedback from the developers if they did investigate the players or even ban them (or if their investigation showed that the player is not cheating). So, I feel that they do not care that there are cheaters in the game, and are not doing anything about them. 
Additionally, every few games there is massive lag that makes game unplayable. 
This is my last season of this game till it changes for better. I will play it again after some major update or new content, but for now there are better games out there.

I'll be honest, I want to like this game. I really do, it is better than it was at launch, but it still has a plethora of problems. 

The map design is bland and forgettable, every Battlefield map managed to be fun in terms of design and interactivity. Heck, I haven't played Battlefield 4 in a while and I still remember a lot of fun from the maps. However once I get off of 2042, I immediately forget the map I played on. Plus, the maps are just too big which is weird to say as a Battlefield player, but having enormous maps just leaves roaming around looking for some action until I get killed by the enemy team. A big example is an oil rig in the Arctic and while that is a cool concept for a map design, there is a lot of open space beyond the rig. It just makes the game tiresome. 

The game feels like its trying to be Call of Duty and Fortnite in terms of victory animations and layout. Battlefield for a while was its own grounded and gritty FPS, but now that's changed with the futuristic vibe and the storyline feeling a bit out of place. 

Environment destruction feels barebones and is essentially wasted potential. 


Do yourself a favor and buy the game on sale. Preferably less than $30. The game is better than at launch and I would definitely play this game over Call of Duty, but that is a low bar to pass. You're better off playing Battlefield 1, 4, Hardline or even V and leave more satisfied from those games.

What can be improved? There are still many players who like the WW1, WW2 setting, but BF 2042 has only 2 maps from BF 1942 and one is just a desert. You have created very cool maps in BF5: Provence, Airfield, Rotterdam, Pacific Storm, Narvik and other very nice, atmospheric maps with destructibility, terrain, meadows, villages, small details and sounds. This is probably the most frustrating game I've ever played. 

On one hand when a game is fairly even it can be fun and it might even suck you in for hours. 
But sometimes it feels like everyone else is using haxx and it makes you want to punch someone to the balls.

So you managed to sneak up behind the enemy? Well someone will see you the moment you fire a single shot and somehow do a 180 and one-shot you to the head in less than 0.5 seconds. 

So you decided to be a sniper? Well everyone will see your scope glimmer but you won't see theirs somehow.

So you wanted to try and defend? Found an awesome spot to be sneaky? Well someone will know you're there somehow and jump you from the only angle you're not looking and shoot you in the face.

But when you get to stay alive longer than until you fire your first bullet it mis fun sometimes. Not fun enough that i'd ever recommend anyone to spend money on it, but fun enough for a free game or maybe 80+% off.

I don't really love Battlefield, but when I saw that the new BF2042 was on sale for €10, I thought I might as well give it a try and play it, I'm really far away from MP only games, because I've already made that mistake in the past and I played Black Ops 4, which was fun but overall it was quite a disaster, but you can't judge until you try it, right? So I went ahead and tried out a title that half of the people love and half hate, and the result is ... well, quite interesting

[b]Pluses[/b]

Here I have to say from the beginning that this Battlefield has a really good gameplay, although it is like every BF that came out, but you also have the abilities of "Operators" who have different equipment that they can use in battle and can help them in general, by giving something they added a bit of liveliness to Battlefield and the game doesn't seem quite the same as in the previous installments, but even after some time the game can seem to be the same again as it was before which doesn't give off the great energy that you'd probably expect, but those who they have been playing BF for a long time, so they probably knew in advance what they were getting into. Another thing that is quite nice is of course the Graphics side, have you ever seen a BF that doesn't look amazing? Of course not! Each BF has really beautiful graphics that can sometimes take your breath away! But with these beautiful graphics comes a lot of problems. but we'll talk about that later. However, regarding the characters and their modifications, as I pointed out, the characters here have abilities but you can also modify them, don't expect modifications in the form of Cyberpunk 2077. You just change the Clothes and Dyes they wear, which ... is really useless but I take it as a positive because you can die with more style! But another thing is that making these Customizations available again costs you something, and we'll get to that again in a moment. However, what costs you nothing, maybe just Headphones or peace and good sound is the Audiovisual of the game. The developers have done their best to make the sounds sound beautiful and simulate a real battlefield! If you listen carefully, you will hear even the slightest sounds like footsteps, bullets falling, plugging in a new magazine, even the sound of your uniform rubbing as you move, or even your character's breathing, and here I have to say that the developers really messed around, but let's see the Cons.

[b]Cons[/b]

This is where it all breaks down, let's start with the mildest and that is the Battle Pass, yes I know Call of Duty has it too and it doesn't change the situation of both games, but if I take it around and around COD has a Battle Pass that gives you it literally makes the game more enjoyable, this BP just wants to extract money from you for other colors, exp, cards, emblems, etc... It's really like you go and throw money out the window, it's really not worth it. Another thing that totally shocked me was their "Shop" in which I scrolled for a good minute before I got to the end, not even Call of Duty has so many cosmetics in the game for €60. I understand that nowadays the trend is to stuff microtransactions everywhere, and even if no one forces you to buy it, it still spoils the good idea of the game itself, when you see that you can buy so much, it's something else when Microtransactions are in a F2P game, there from of them run the game, but EA is again doing unnecessary things that just bring down their Player Base and Rating of the game! Another thing, if you look at the Equipment, you really have a lot of weapons here, some are locked because you don't own the Elite Edition for €90 (I'm sorry EA, I'd rather pre-order the game in the full Edition next time!) and the ones you have unlocked are not much You can't customize, because everything is locked and you have to unlock it by playing and killing, so you spend a lot of time with one weapon without at the end of unlocking all the Attachments saying that it was time well spent! Unfortunately, the biggest lightning struck here is Optimization, although I reduced the details of the game for some things even to Minimum, I still had FPS drops in the Game Menu, with the addition of Microlags and increased Latency in the game (Although Nvidia Low Latency was on ON) And playing an FPS game with such conditions is almost a superhuman task. Regardless, let's get into the game, there you will find that the only mode that is played is Conquest, with others you can wait for half an hour and you will be in the lobby with a maximum of 4 and wait for other players, the total indifference of the developers to somehow take care of their game has resulted in quite a locked game where you can only play one Mode, which can get pretty boring after a few hours. Despite the fact that the Anticheat is so great that you practically don't even notice that there is one at all! Conclusion, this Battlefield shows us that even though you can be a multi-million dollar company, you are still just trying to make money and you don't care what will happen in your game, if you are looking for some good BF you better go back to BF4 or BF3 this game is just not worth it! I can't recommend it even at a discount, I have the impression that your wallet will thank you even more.

Played on:
AMD Ryzen 5 2600 (6-Core)
GeForce GTX 1660 Super (GDDR6 | 6GB VRAM)
Corsair Kit 2x8GB 2666MHz
Windows 11

[b] PROS AND CONS [/b]
✔ Graphic Design
✔ Gameplay
✔ Weapon elements and customization
✔ Audiovisual

✘ LOADS of Microtransactions
✘ Big grind
✘ Low rate of Maps
✘ A very problematic Anticheat
✘ Big lack of concern for game mods and gameplay sustainability
✘ Developers' indifference to the game itself

A Constructive Perspective on Battlefield 2042

I've been navigating the virtual battlefields of Battlefield 2042, and while the game has its merits, a few issues have caught my attention. Despite my overall positive experience, there are a couple of aspects that could use some refinement.

Firstly, I've encountered occasional lag and input delays, even on servers with a ping below 60-70. It's a minor hiccup, but addressing this would undoubtedly enhance the overall gameplay experience.

Art style is a subjective matter, and unfortunately, the current one doesn't resonate with me. I find myself yearning for the grittier aesthetics of Battlefield 4, which had a more visceral and immersive feel. While personal preferences may differ, a touch of nostalgia for the previous art style is something I can't shake off.

On a gameplay note, I'd love to see the return of the weapons leaning and mounting mechanics from Battlefield 4. These elements added an extra layer of strategy to engagements, and their absence is felt in the current iteration. It would be fantastic if the Devs Team at DICE could consider reintroducing these mechanics.

Furthermore, the impact of the weapons in Battlefield 2042 could be heightened by improving the firing and related sound effects. The current guns lack the punchiness that made their Battlefield 4 counterparts so satisfying. A return to the visceral audio experience of Battlefield 4 would undoubtedly elevate the intensity of firefights and contribute to a more immersive gaming environment.

In summary, while Battlefield 2042 has its strengths, addressing these minor issues could make a substantial difference in the overall gaming experience. I look forward to potential updates and improvements from the Devs Team, hoping that they consider the constructive feedback from the community to make Battlefield 2042 even more exceptional.

Since money is the only language the folks at DICE and EA speak, I'll sum it up like this.

If you guys import the remaining maps from the games you guys shut down servers for and pulled from the stores, people would flock to 2042 and buy it just for those maps alone. You guys are literally burning gold.

I know BF3 is next on the chopping block. Do us a favor and give us the rest of those maps as well.

Also, please add random map rotation in Portal so I don't have to play the same maps in the same order.

Do all of these things and I will rebuy the game and change my review to recommended.

tl;dr: Extremly overpowered game breaking vehicles and matchmaking issues.

November 2023 Update:
The matchmaking is really bad. There is no option to select the region and the matchmaking will not put you in a game if you have 40+ latency. Everytime you search a game it will just put you in an empty lobby which never fills up for 40+ minutes to even hit the minimum player number to start the round.
 The only option is to join someone on your friend list who lives in another region who is ALREADY game or else if you try to search for a game while being in a party, again it will throw you in an eternal waiting lobby with no players.
Just a simple region select or the system expanding its search radius instead of just putting you in a empty lobby wouldve solve this issue.
So many players online, but none of them can find a game.

On the other side, the vehicles are so overpowered that none of the classes have anything in this inventory arsenal against them. Which means, that anytime someone gets in a vehicle they are going 150+ kills and 0 deaths per game as there is nothing against them to stop them.

Old Review (Outdated)-

Current performance is really smooth and stable. Games are available most of the times, actually decent AI Bots which do something to fill the game between empty servers to get the game started while more players join. Decent weapon balance and improved maps. Operators now kind of fit into the narrative of BF2042. Kinda sad the game does not have a campaign, it would really improve a reason for why the factions are fighting for.

If only the game launched anywhere close to the state it is in right now, it would have been regarded as one of the best Battlefields out there.



OLD OUTDATED REVIEW BELOW-

Still a lot of performance issues. Consider buying only during heavy sales.

1 Year update: tl;dr; the game is now overrun by hackers, skip it completely.

2 Year Update: The game is now playble and decent. The playerbase has drastically died off, EA took too long to fix this.

 The game has been out for so long and took so long to fix just to make it playble on powerful hardware, even if you manage to run the game now, it is full of hackers. Skip over this one, even during heavy sales.
Furthermore, due to these "updates and fixes" the game has even more severe performance issues on older hardware.
The most disturbing part about this game was how I would only be seemingly killed by players using controllers. I could not figure it out until I plugged a controller in myself and played with it, immediately saw how easy this game was with this controller "aim assist", just look in the general direction of the opponent's head and pull the trigger and the game zeros in on the head almost like an aimbot. Can pull off easy headshots all day long, I don't play fps on controllers so my hands were sore fairly quick. Just press one button on the controller and the game does everything for you.

Tested this game on my newer and older systems.
System Specs:

System 1: AMD5800X3D - RTX3070 - 32GB RAM = Playble. Lot of noticeable frequent micro-stutters and game freezes every now and then. Game is extremely CPU heavily, processor pinned at 100% majority of the time even on lowest settings.Changing game setting only seems to affect GPU load while the CPU load remains constant. Max settings still runs the game at 70+ FPS but has severe input latency on anything above medium settings while the game in motion looks the same. Anyone who actually plays shooter games knows input latency is a straight up no-no, it literally kills the game. Personally I run the game at playdoh settings to keep the input latency at the minimum and it is still noticeable, visuals and fps are not important to me as overall system responsiveness. 60fps is decent enough to be good at the game, system latency is the most important of them all.

System 2: Intel 7700HQ - GTX1060 6GB - 16GB RAM = Completely Unplayble even on lowest settings. Game assets straight-up don't even load-in most of the time, missing player guns and player-models, only HUD visible on the screen, can only see red enemy nametag floating around and the buildings and other small assets don't even load in. 15-20FPS average with severe game and system freezes leading to forced powerbutton shutdows as it renders system completely unresponsive. Left it 10+ minutes to see if it fixes itself or generates even a single new frame with no response.

Update, System 3- 5800X3D - RTX4080. 
Now the game feels playble and you can feel the disappointment in 4K UHD HDR 144FPS.

I am a massive fan of the Battlefield franchise, and I have played every installment for over 4,000 hours since Bad Company 2. I was eagerly waiting for the release of BF2042, but unfortunately, the initial release was a disaster that killed the franchise for me. 

Now, in 2024, I am playing BF2042 again, and while it's right, it doesn't feel like an actual Battlefield game to me. It's a good shooter with vehicles but lacks the large-scale war experience that made the franchise so engaging. In previous Battlefield games, you were just a tiny part of a massive war machine, and when you managed to make a difference in a match, it felt like a personal victory against all odds. 

I recommend getting this game on sale, but don't expect it to be an actual Battlefield game. It's a fun shooter with vehicles, but it doesn't live up to the franchise's standards.

im gonna try and make this a fair review but i cant remove all my bias. the only reason i picked up this game after 2 years was because it was on sale for 8 dollars and its the first battlefield with crossplay that i can play with all my old console friends.

the game overall is fun in its current state and if i had never played another battlefield game i would think this game is pretty darn good. but that is not the world we live in. so many aspects of the game from a fundamental standpoint are much worse than previous battlefield titles. 

the reworked specialist system is not well balanced and the infantry vs vehicle combat has suffered greatly because of this feature the game was built upon. Even partnered with a friend, tanks and aircraft are almost impossible to kill unless they play stupidly. 

the maps do not feel good to play and there is genuinely maybe 2 maps that are not a remaster that flow well or allows a multitude of different combat styles. after 2 years of content there is only 13 playable maps which most battlefields have at least 20 by this time. the map sizes make traversing from point to point take minutes and there are some how less vehicles spawns on the ground than in previous titles. redacted is the only map in the game worth running smgs / shotguns on but otherwise with the increased map size to accommodate 128 players every other map you are almost required to run dmrs, assault rifles, snipers, or lmgs.

the engine itself is downgraded from previous titles. the physical input of mouse sometimes doesn't work right 100% of the time making some quick flicks not register, its a rare issue but never have i had this issue with a previous battlefield. this time around there is almost no destruction. besides from a couple inconsequential buildings most structures around objectives and chokes are not destructible at all. battlefield 1 and 5 the game previous to this one had amazing destruction and it almost doesn't exist in this title. wheeled vehicles have never felt worse to drive in a battlefield game, they are sluggish, not responsive and almost all of them feel ready to tip over on small bumps. 

The graphics themselves feel weird to talk about in this game as ya they are good but for what this game should have been it should not be on par with how battlefield 4 looked in 2014 with the resolution just a bit higher. there is no style or substance to the graphics that battlefield 1 and 5 did amazingly. 

solider animations in some aspects are what you expect with good detailed animations but in other cases they are awful. some launchers and pistols just reload off screen and this game committed the sin of trying to copy 3rd person take downs from call of duty mw 2019. battlefield 1 is still the very best example of how to do proper first person take down animations and this game failed in this aspect hard even though this is a sequel and by the same studio.

the weapons themselves and the plus system is one of the few high points to game. the weapons look very good, and sound design is ranges from passable to very good. the plus system allows you to change how your weapon is kitted on the fly which is super nice but also heavily contributes to why smgs and shotguns arent usable in 95% of situations. an ar can be kitted foir close or long range when there is 95 % more long range situations. i dont know if its a bug or laziness but i loaded into a portal match and the m1 garand doesnt have a ping when it reloads......

The music. How has a battlefield game fallen so hard from grace in this aspect. I listen to the sound tracks from bf 3, bf4, bf5, and bf1 all the time because they are awesome. this is sound track sucks ass. the battlefield legacy theme is mixed so badly that it sounds like nails on a chalkboard and there is no notable piece of music ive listened to any where in the game.

This game in a vacuum is a fun alll out war experience and still feels like a battlefield game at least after 2 years now. i would still recommend playing battlefield 5 right now as that game still has better player numbers and is a better more cohesive experience. this game is worth probably 25 to 35 dollars but definitely not 60 or 70. Its just such a disappointment as you see how much effort went into the game but the direction and thought wasn't focused enough and because of it every single aspect of the game is worse than previous battlefield titles. 

Dice, stop chasing trends like, battle royales, battle passes, and hero elements/ specialists. you can add that stuff later if you have a successful game. just take the same steps you guys did to develop battlefield 3, 4, and 1 and you will make a lot of money. you have a golden goose of a franchise that has about one more bad egg and then the goose is dead

I am very satisfied with this game. The return of bots in 64 player coop maps really rings home to me since the last battlefield game to support this was Battlefield 2 in 2005. I especially love how we can go on portal.battlefield.com and create custom games that we can host. Battlefield 1942 maps with battlefield 3 equipment! Great Job EA! Way to bring back battlefield to the good old days with modern graphics! The main issue I had with the newer battlefields BFBC2 to BFV was the inability to provide a practice environment on vehicles and weapons systems before heading into actual battle against humans. This gives players an edge to see what the maps are like, what the equipment feels like to operate, and to know the limits of each vehicle before fighting anyone PVP online. 

The next thing EA has got to get working on is getting the game unborked on Linux.

Sooooo, it has been eight months after launch and Battlefield 2042 has finally released its first season ' Zero Hour'. Is it too late? or has DICE managed to show a little hope for the future of Battlefield 2042...

Firstly, I understand what DICE has done with Battlefield 2042 and honestly, it is inexcusable. I did play it on day one on the series X and used the 10-hour free trial (of which I didn't even use all the 10 hours ), so I am completely aware of what state the game launched at. It had a horrendous launch, It wasn't what we hoped for, it wasn't what we as fans of the whole franchise wanted. That release will forever be encrusted as a brown skid mark at the back of my shorts, a stain which many fans have and DICE and EA will have to live with. 

Trust me, I was, and still am pretty P****D about this. It is a great shame to see a series I have been with since the beginning fall so low and gain probably the most hated and highest number of bad reviews I have seen. It felt like a massive kick in the nut sack, especially when the developers continuously talked about listening to the fans on what they wanted while creating the game. 

With that being said, it does seem like DICE is continuing to support the game and trying to make it as good as it can be. So where are we at currently and has it got better? 

I hate to say it, and I know you will all hate to read it. But yes, things are getting better. This was the first time playing it since launch so I haven't touched it since it was first released as I refused to. I was curious upon season 1 release as to what had improved and I was quite surprised. 

The new map 'Exposure': It is unique, there are tunnels to explore, mountains to climb, and beautiful environments with great use of colour throughout. Most importantly, it feels like a battlefield map. You feel like you have direction and don't just land in the open wondering  'okay where am I going. it is clear where you should be defending or where you should be attacking. It has many channelling points which creates the fun times of BF4 when you have 30 men behind a door on each side and everyone is pushing to get through with 101 grenades rolling through. This for me was Battlefield when it was just chaos in many areas. Thankfully this is back, especially on breakthrough mode. The map is big but not so big that it feels like a walking simulator but also it's not small enough to get shot from multiple different points so it's a great balance. it does also have a great balance between infantry and vehicles. 

The battle pass is the same as all the other battle passes out there with 100 tiers to go through. The major unlocks are free unlocks and there are no pay-to-win elements unless you count buying tiers as part of it. Mostly cosmetic unlocks but all great additions. As far as I can tell, it is a pretty fair battle pass which does not feel like a complete grind to get through. The weekly missions are not difficult to achieve which gives you a lot of XP towards the pass. I have already hit level 40 within the pass. Thankfully there are no crazy outfits such as clown heads to unlock or some crazy Fortnite stuff. All unlocks thankfully are decent cosmetics that keep the feel of a modern shooter such as normal camo unlocks or military-style outfits. 

Due to there being a lot to talk about and many changes being made it is hard to fit it all in as season one comes with a lot of changes. What I will say about this update is it does make battlefield 2042 feel like a completely new game compared to when it launched and I mean that in a really good way. Again I know many of you don't like to hear that but it is true. I noticed instantly the guns felt so much better to use and not so aggressive with acceleration as before. Hit detection is especially better with bullets being on point with the targets. I feel like the character is much freer to move around whereas before it felt a little heavy and restricted. In general, is a more polished and more enjoyable experience than before. 

Is it too late ?? 
That is hard to say, but I don't think it is too late for the developers/studio to save the game. Let's rewind to the launch of No Mans Sky for example. no one would have expected that to rebound as well as it has. I had completely written off that game with their updates and pathetic content release, but look where we are now ?? it's honestly come a long way and now it is a top seller. I will keep hope that Battlefield will bounce back like NMS. 

Overall, My thoughts on Battlefield 2042 season 1 are mostly positive. Yes, it's not perfect and yes some things do need a little more tweaking as I do encounter small bugs here and there but not as many as I first encountered. I have seen very little actually in the past 24 hours of gameplay. Sure I am still P****D that we had to wait so long for season 1 but it is a massive step in the right direction! 

It is clear that DICE is finally starting to listen to the fan's feedback and they are applying it to areas. It still has a long way to go but it is a step forward at least. The update is a solid step toward building a better Battlefield. The update will bring people out of the brink and start to love the game again but it doesn't hold enough content just yet and I feel some may burn out and get bored quickly.

There is a shimmering hope that this game can be turned around, Exposure is the most 'Battlefield' map 2042 has to offer with its great map design. It's well-paced and the most fun I have had on a map. The gameplay tweaks are noticeable and a massive improvement from the launch. These updates do make the older maps fun to go back to also. 

So if you can see past the 100k bad reviews and fancy giving it a try again? then you probably won't be disappointed. Well not as much as you probably were on day one. If you don't fancy paying for the game just yet then get EA Play and use the 10-hour free trial to test it out. That's what I did and then brought the game half price two weeks back. It's still not worth full price so I recommend waiting for a sale or checking on other websites for discounts.

Unfortunately the reviews here are mostly negative which paints such a bad picture for the game. Filter reviews by latest first and you will see a recent massive improvement to the game and the good reviews it is receiving. The past 4500 reviews are 41% positive at the day of writing this (02/07/22).  Those negative reviews are deserved at launch but try the game for yourself now and see past the negative comments this time. If this review has made you give it another chance, that's great news!! Happy Gaming :)

Like it or not, Battlefield's still the only name for fast, fun, run & gun, sandboxy big team battle FPS. No contest, don't even try to hit me with that Battlebit bull shi (i do like that game though). BUT
This will max (probably) everyone's CPU out to 100% the second you get to the main menu. If your cores or frequency don't make the cut, it will drop frames consistently.

Then there's just a pile of whack, weird, goofy ass decisions that was\is made pretty consistently. Like, DICE put a lot of work into revamping multiple 128-player maps, and then almost immediately after, forced the 128 playlist into only playing two or three of those maps at a time. Or take for example: There's one single pump shotgun in the game which is outperformed in every way by every other shotgun. Your 12g "shorty" shotgun-secondary gets one-shot kills more consistently and at better range than the 870. It's been the worst shotgun pick across the board for months. And then at the start of Dark Creations they NERFED IT. 

Don't even get me started on the music. I like music. Across all the BF's there have been some pretty good soundtracks for the menu & gameplay cues, but this one's bar none the worst. Go pick any three tracks from BFV and then listen to what's on the 2042 main menu, or match start. BFV sounds like a composer's homage to a sobering war. 2042 sounds like they made an intern produce it after bombing his family.

I quit playing after a couple months when the game was released in October of 2021. Here we are in the beginning of 2024 and the game is still sh** to play. Still has bugs. Still lags like a mofo. Nothing creative about the game play. Many times, you're running forward only to be pulled back several spots from where you just were. Aiming with a scope is a guessing game in of itself to try and hit a target at distance. Clearly this was not really thought out. Like the rest of the game. Wanna fly a helicopter or fighter jet? Good luck with how touchy the controls get for no reason. Trying to get a somewhat decent squad together is next to impossible. There is zero teamwork to be had in the game, and EA/Dice have made it that way. It's a free for all between two sides. Zero initiative to get players to work together. 

If my name were listed as being a developer for this game, I'd quit this line of work. Because clearly the people who made this game forgot how to make a game that isn't crap from the get go. Let's face it, FPS games peaked well over 10 year ago. Everything that has come out in recent years has been trash. And BF 2042 is at the top of the heap of garbage stinking up the place. If this continues to get sh**ier, just call it Diarrhea 2042 instead.

Battlefield™ 2042 is a large-scale, action-packed shooter that puts players in the middle of a chaotic warzone. The game features a variety of game modes, maps, weapons, and vehicles to keep things interesting. However, the game can be overwhelming at times, and it lacks a focus on infantry combat.

Overall, Battlefield™ 2042 is a fun game for fans of large-scale shooters. However, it's not for everyone.

Here are some specific things that I like about the game:

The visuals are stunning.
The sound design is amazing.
The gameplay is fast-paced and exciting.
I would recommend Battlefield™ 2042 to anyone who enjoys large-scale shooters. However, I would caution players who are looking for a more infantry-focused experience.

I bought this game when it came out because I was a hardcore Battlefield player throughout the years but this game has gotten worse to date, The class system for this game is ridiculously horrid why have specialist this is supposed to a be Battlefield game where you can customize your character and look different from each other not have 15 Sundances flying around or other characters looking the same, heck the AI look more better than the specialist with no fancy gadgets or anything like that. 
The updating of the maps to look better are a joke literally all the extra objects added take more fps with the constant frame drops I even have the game set to low I can play every other game on ultra but this game. 
The main issue I'm having the most is the fun I try to have fun with this game but that's not possible on Battlefield 2042 the constant base camping or spawning on your team mates and instantly dyeing with no camera to see if its clear to spawn or not, the weapons are over and under powered for certain classes with the new update on (1/31/20023) which make no sense for the assault class to use a sniper rifle, I think that Battlefield 2042 should take a lot of steps from the other Battlefield franchises and see how the community effected those games like BF3, BC2 and BF4.

[h1] After 2 years, this game continues to be a half-baked product that fails to capture the identity and spirit of Battlefield. [/h1]

I know there's tons of people who will tell you: [quote] "oh, but it's good now, they've updated the game and fixed all of the issues". [/quote] [b] Well..... no. It's not good, and they have not fixed all of the issues. [/b] 

Yes, it has improved some since release, but it's still plagued with bugs that pop up with each update and terrible implementations of overused ideas that do not work well together, and do not belong in a Battlefield setting. 

[list]
[*] We still have ridiculous "main characters/operators" that are ripped straight out of Apex Legends or Rainbow 6 Siege. 
[*] We still have a garbage instant matchmaking system with no server browser that will actually tell you if the game you are joining is a complete dumpster fire or if it's only a few players in the lobby and everyone else is bots. 
[*] The whole idea of Portal being the ultimate answer to anything you want from a Battlefield game has not been developed or changed at all since launch. So no, it's NOT a "love letter to the fans".
[*] Every new gun that is introduced is OP in order to convince everyone to spend money and buy in-game currency so you can buy a Battle-pass, which still expires every month, requiring the player-base to buy another Battle-pass and give greedy EA even more money. Those new guns will be nerfed the next season in order to start the whole chain all over again.
[*] Recently EA slowed down their progression on how much the experience you gain with each game counts towards Battle-pass progression. So now they're attempting to force you to buy the premium-priced "Early Start/Boosted" Battlepass in order to progress through the Battle-pass at anything less than an agonizing grind.
[*] Most of the maps are still empty feeling and open to a point where sometimes it's just a bunch or rocks or a hill on each point with tons of open space between each point. Yayyyyy now it's just a running simulator for 5 minutes until you get blown away by a heli. So much fun!
[*] Don't be too surprised if your team gets completely swept round after round because there are no attempts at all at balancing in this game. If one team has 30 players and the other team has 20 players the game's solution is to add 10 bots that are barely a token of help to the team with 20 players. So now when more players join they will continue to be dropped on the team with 30 players, guess how that goes? Hint: not well.
[*] A new unique addition to the game with the recent update is the game crashing or showing a black screen instead of loading into a match. So far I have seen this issue primarily with NVIDIA drivers, and it happens nearly every 2 to 3 games. 
[*] Oh, you happened to be lucky enough to have 3 other friends who are willing to play with you? Well if you have a full party of 4 players you will be thrown into separate squads in the beginning of every match. So you have to make a new squad and get everyone back together. Such an amazing experience.
[/list]

There's about 30 other gripes I have with this game, but I'm tired of typing. 

[h3] The bottom line is: BF2042 is still a disaster and a smear upon the franchise name. [/h3]

It's a money grab, and clearly they intend to pump the player-base cash-cow for as long as they can until they release the next uncompleted game with "Battlefield" tacked onto it. I keep playing this game with friends because I want it to be better. But it's never going to improve enough to be worth anything more than $10-15 as it is. Especially not with the Battle-pass unlock system.

Battlefield 2047: Where Hovercrafts Do Donuts and Bullets Do Ballet (and Sometimes Hit Each Other)

Imagine this: a future where hovercrafts dance on skyscrapers, tanks waltz through sandstorms, and bullets pirouette around corners before finding their forever home in someone's kneecap. That's Battlefield 2047, a game where the only thing more chaotic than the action is trying to explain it to your grandma.

Let's break it down:

• Hovercrafts: They're like mechanical butterflies with the firepower of a pissed-off hippo. You'll soar through the air, raining robo-bees of death on your enemies, and somehow manage to not land on your own teammates (most of the time).

• Gadgets: Forget your puny grenades. Here, you've got EMP grenades that turn tanks into disco balls, grappling hooks that make Spiderman jealous, and wingsuits that let you escape like a disappointed bird.

• Maps: From neon-drenched megacities to sandblasted wastelands, each map is a playground for mayhem. You'll be dodging laser fire in zero-g, sniping from the top of a collapsing skyscraper, and getting run over by a hovercraft while trying to capture a point named "Bob's Discount Bullets."

But Battlefield 2047 ain't all sunshine and hover-rainbows.

• Bugs: They're like uninvited guests at your party, except they steal your ammo and replace your bullets with nerf darts. You might clip through walls, get launched into the stratosphere, or witness a tank spontaneously combust. Just roll with it, it's all part of the Battlefield charm (or lack thereof).

• Teamwork? What teamwork?: Let's be honest, half your team will be off doing their own thing, probably breakdancing on top of a tank. But hey, that one clutch revive or perfectly timed EMP grenade can turn the tide of battle and make you feel like a tactical genius (even if you were just spamming buttons).

So, should you buy Battlefield 2047?

If you're looking for a polished, bug-free experience, go play checkers with your grandma. But if you crave over-the-top action, ridiculous gadgets, and enough chaos to make a hurricane jealous, then strap in, buttercup. Battlefield 2047 is a wild ride, and sometimes, that's all you need.

Just remember:

• Aim for the kneecaps, they're extra squishy in the future.

• Don't trust anyone, especially yourself on a hovercraft.

• And if all else fails, just dance. Bullets can't waltz.

Final verdict: 7 out of 10 disco balls. It's got its flaws, but the sheer absurdity of it all makes it strangely addictive. Just don't blame me if you start breakdancing with your grandma's walker after a few rounds.

P.S. If you see me in-game, I'm the one teabagging enemies with a baguette. Come say hi!

Latest end of 2023 review: This game, after all the updates it's gotten, is still not a good game. One of the most glaring things I hate about it, is that it's a cracked-out, ADHD garbage version of the original battlefield games that requires zero strategy to play, about 99% of the time. 

You literally spawn die spawn die spawn die so fast, even if you're getting 30-40+ kills in a match. It's like they took the original formula and made it like Apex Legends or the other stupid games like it to appeal to young teenagers. It's awful.

Nearly all of the maps have zero cover, require you to walk far too long to get to the cap, the cover at the cap can easily all be demolished on capture points, nearly all of the servers limit the amount of vehicles you can get, which means you are either going to walk, you're going to camp a point, or you'll not participate and wait 2 minutes for a vehicle to spawn so you can farm damage again.

It brings out the worst in players. Often times, all players do is camp in vehicles and rack up double the amount of kills anyone else has in the match. It's almost never a fun time. I imagine the only people that will enjoy this is 13-16yo kids hyped up on monster engergy drinks. 

If you aren't a kid hyped up on mountain dew and pizza rolls, and want something with more substance - Go play a game like Hell Let Loose...it's far more in-line with what Battlefield used to be in my opinion.

I played a few hours (14) and had some fun, but took a break from it when life got busy. So I come back to the game weeks later and find I can't even get into matches. Then I saw the user reviews have tanked. Apparently there is loads of cheating (doesn't surprise me), and people are having issues joining matches as well. I requested a refund.

I skipped the last 2 Battlefield games, and it looks like I'm skipping this one too.

BF2042 is no longer complete crap... just slightly crap. The game is well worth the investment if you've got €11.99 spare for some MP carnage. The game however still appears to struggle on a performance level (Mobile 4060) and struggling to maintain consistent FPS on LOW settings. I would argue that perhaps the hardware (Gaming Laptop) isn't up to the task but then again... this is the [b]1st[/b] game to have seemingly made it fall behind. I can't recommend the BP (content doesn't seem too worthwhile) unless you're planning to make this game your "main" game for playtime sake. Other than that - EA/DICE appears to have corrected course on this rather rocky ship and we can only hope that future updates continue to refine and polish the experience.

BLUF: This game is the buggiest game I have seen in a long time for a full release game.

I can not recommend this game above a $20 price point, nor to ANYONE that deal with problems that result in instantaneous termination of game play. So some friends and I saw the price drop significantly on Battlefield 2024 and decided that despite warning of others here we would throw some cash at it. These friends and I have varying system specs which go from mine (i7-10700K, 20280 Super, 32GB RAM) to others with much higher specs. For myself, I ran the game at recommended settings and pushed to a meager 1080P monitor. I understand that sometimes a specific rig sometimes just doesn't work well with a game sometimes, but when we cant get a team going in BF 2042 because EACH of us is crashing or freezing at random intervals, well that kind of eliminates the hardware as the issue. This game is EXTREMELY FUN when it is not freezing or just straight up locking up the entire PC, requiring a hard restart. I have played Alpha and Beta state games with less game play ending freezes and crashes in a 24 hours period.

Please modify the scoring system of the scoreboard. 
    First of all, let's talk about the scoring method and the unequal distribution of points. For example, if you only mark an enemy and your teammate Gills them, you only get half the points of a regular Gill. However, if you deal 99 damage to an enemy and your teammate finishes them off, you still only get half the points of a regular Gill. The scoring for marking assists and Gill assists, two abilities with completely different scoring methods, are equated directly in the new system. 
    Let's delve into the scoring for Gills and assist Gills. In the previous game, if you Gill an enemy that your teammate has damaged, you receive points equivalent to the damage you inflicted and the points for the Gill. Your teammate also receives points for the damage they caused and the assist Gill points. Moreover, if your teammate inflicts a certain amount of damage, they also receive the Gill credit. 
    Now, let's talk about capture points.In 2042, the scoring for capturing points works in a way that you receive points for completing a capture or neutralizing a point, but you only receive points at the moment of completion. For instance, if you leave the area at the last second after completing the capture, you receive no points. If you capture half of the point and a teammate runs over to share the points, the person who captures the point for the entire duration and the one who captures half receive the same points. It's truly interesting. 
    For example, in Conquest mode, if you, as an Assault player, successfully approach an enemy vehicle, throw a grenade, and manage to destroy it, but the enemy bails out in time and you don't Gill them, you only receive a mere 50 EXP and no points, whereas in the previous game, destroying a vehicle would grant you points.
    The unequal and missing scoring systems fail to provide players with good feedback, fail to motivate players, and no one likes it when they finally check the scoreboard and find themselves at the bottom.

I'll say this. As someone who's put in an ungodly amount of hours into CoD, since BO1-MWIII. This is refreshing. I've dabbled with BF games too, since bad company. This game isn't as smooth as BF4, BFV or BF One, however. Since the updates and patches, this game is hands down better than the last 3 CoD games. I can actually put on some music in my headphones and play this game for a couple of hours and not feel like I was competing in a professional setting. I know my lobbies and experiences are not being manipulated and if there is SBMM, it's not even noticeable, or rather, predictable. Despite there being a battle-pass, which I despise about games now-a-days, it at the very least has numerous challenges that seem to be accomplish-able in just one game's setting. I've leveled up from 1 to over 20 in just over 2 hours of gameplay, granted, I believe there's double XP going right now.

24/04/2022 - No improvement in sight. The game remains subpar.

17/12/2021 UPDATE - The game is still a disappointment. Stuttering issues persist, affecting server connection more than in-game FPS. The maps, guns, and vehicles (both land and air) are overpowered, contributing to an overall lackluster experience.

Post Launch Review - 19/11/21

One day before -
A minor 1GB update brought a few fixes, addressing some quality of life issues. However, it failed to address the major concerns. The alleged server upgrade didn't bring significant improvement.

Review -
Weapons and Vehicles:

Despite the game's potential, numerous severe issues mar the experience. Every gun feels unbalanced, resembling airsoft guns at times. For instance, the starting AR has a 31-round magazine, yet it takes around 20 shots to kill an enemy, making fights against multiple opponents nearly impossible.

Hitting shots is a challenge due to an added glare that causes bullets to stray from the intended direction. Bullet registration issues persist, affecting not only main weapons but also launchers that sometimes fail to register hits on vehicles even after impact.

Sniper rifles are only effective with consistent headshots; hitting an opponent multiple times with a .50 cal may not guarantee success.

Many vehicles are overpowered, with the ability to auto-repair without a repair tool. This leads to players staying inside tanks the entire game, exploiting the regenerating health and unlimited ammunition. The combination is detrimental to gameplay.

Bugs:

The game is riddled with bugs, ranging from continuous reload prompts to getting stuck in the crouch position. The list includes issues like an endless death countdown, guns stopping firing, inability to look up or down, jittery tank first-person view, and more.

Performance/Optimization:

Despite claims of server upgrades, high-level GPUs are maxed out, and the game lacks optimization. Performance fluctuates drastically, impacting the overall gaming experience negatively.

Lack of Modes:

The game offers only three modes, excluding Portal. The absence of popular modes from previous Battlefield titles is a glaring omission.

Portal:

While Portal offers a variety of maps and game modes, it comes at a cost. Players are awarded XP for soldier levels but won't level up guns, limiting attachment unlocks. Portal feels more like post-game content.

In conclusion, the game is plagued with issues, and each play session reveals new glitches. I advise against purchasing until a major update addresses weapon balancing, vehicle meta, adds more game modes, maps, and weapons, optimizes the game, and resolves the numerous bugs. At its current state, the £40 base price is unjustified. I still love the game when it works, but the flaws are too glaring. This release is unacceptable for a AAA title, and I won't be preordering any Battlefield games in the future. My recommendation: wait until it's fixed, if it ever will be.
