My original review was "pick it up if its on sale" and gave it a thumbs down.

Now, after playing it for an additional 60hrs, id say pick it up if its on sale. Thumbs up.

The launch was atrocious... We all know what happened. I will give them credit for fixing most things, but there are problems that they cant fix, and things that should not have been present on launch. It's a good game though there is still a lot of ugly. However; I feel like the ugly can largely be ignored or played around.

Here is some ugly.

This game feels more like a tech demo than it does an actual Battlefield game. The amount of AI that can fill your lobbies is a bit much. I find myself in lobbies that are 60%+ filled with AI. Its mostly late at night, unfortunately when i'm able to get my gaming in. So. Lots of AI.
The weather events, theyre just annoying when they come around. They don't add anything to the experience other than your screen gets a glitchy animation, it changes visibility, throws shit around, whatever. It's more of an inconvenience. However, they made this happen less often. I think it should just be gone....
The specialist aspect is... Eh. I think it was dumb to add that in, it definitely stops people from playing as a team as much. You dont find a lot of ammo around. Makes it hard to take down tanks and helis, which are already a little too beefy. A standard loadout wont even take down 1 heavy armor vehicle. And with the upgrades on vehicles, it may take several resupplies to take down ONE vehicle. Specialists do have some cool gadgets. Its nice that they have things that can shake up the gameplay. However, theres really only a few that are meta and actually super useful. Nade spam chick, dude that denies throwables, chick  that has tons of rockets, and a chick that heals and revives like crazy. Theyre like 70% of the choosing. But they really dont add anything to the game other than a way for EA to sell cosmetics. They could have just made them gadgets, which is essentially what it is now. The massive maps is a downside. They were just WAY too open for the amount of players, even when they had the massive lobbies. Just play the smaller player count lobbies. Maps are smaller, it makes it not a running simulator, you can actually make it to more than 2 objectives per game, and keeps combat flowing. They just wanted to show you that they could make huge maps and handle the player count. It means nothing now.

Aside from the things listed above, its a regular battlefield experience. It still isnt better than BF4 or BF1. The gadgets and crap kinda ruin it for most people. They just make it a little Fortnite-y. But it looks good, plays well, runs well (cap your frames), pretty solid. Just... They need to move on to the next game and really redeem themselves.

I bought the game in the beginning of Season 1, on the summer sale. The game is good at that time that it convinced me to buy the Ultimate Edition 2 weeks later. Now it's in season 3 and the game gets better and better. I know the game had a bad launch, but devs are listening to the community and make some good changes. Season 3 came up with a huge boost on performance, I have about 20% more fps in game, about 140-150 fps in Medium Settings and 110-120 fps in High Settings. Im using i5 12400F and 6600XT with 16GB RAM. CPU at 55% - 55°C and GPU at 96% - 65-70°C. New map and weapons are good, it's fun to play these days with a huge load of new players, servers are full of people and I really enjoy it. The game overall is good to try now, especially with the current sale. I love BF1, and now I love 2042 as well as BF1.
Update in December 2023: The game is pretty good now I can say, will more balance updates. The game can be consider as a good FPS game for new players. But for me, it doesnt have the epic atmosphere like other BF games. I dont want to play it everyday like I was with BF1. The soul of BF series is not on BF2042.

Year 2023 Q4. The game is simply terrible, a typical example of the decline of the Battlefield series and EA's greed. We get a very weak semi-finished product for the full price, only to be repeatedly punched in the face with the in-game store and battlepasses. Additionally, the game design itself is really bad and has nothing to do with the legacy of the Battlefield series, e.g. BF1942, BF2, BF3 and especially BF4.

I would like to refer to a few aspects of the game itself that absolutely repel me as a fan (now ex-fan) of the Battlefield series. First of all, the map design is very bad and bland, straight from some pathetic pubg or other crap. The game has nothing to do with war and is more like arcade crap for children than a large-scale war game. A very small number of maps, as I mentioned earlier, of very poor quality. A small number of weapons with customizations (a fraction of those in BF4). Plus some characters, pseudo customization hidden behind the shop... there is no place for individualism in war! We don't want character names, pseudo-plots (which are idiotic) and other inventions. They are supposed to be soldiers - preferably with a covered face like in BF4 with the option of personalization based on military gear, not idiotic colorful camouflages that have nothing to do with camouflages. And the very idea of "stateless people" deserves disciplinary dismissal among DICE employees and humiliates this game. The physics of the game 2 years after the premiere is also a joke, the handling of vehicles and their "mass" is a very bad joke.

This isn't Battlefield anymore. This is some pathetic hybrid of pubg, fortnite and call of duty. Nothing remains of this series except the title. The game is absolutely not worth more than a few euros (single digit value). And you certainly shouldn't settle for any in-game stores inside a full-price product.

If I bought this game for more than a ridiculous fraction of a percent, I would demand a refund and a refund of medicines to "unsee" this "abomination".

Unfortunately, my friends and I have to go back to BF4, Hell Let Loose and ARMA. There's nothing we like about this game. We've been waiting 2 years for this game to be fixed, but it's still a very bad joke and not a Battlefield game. Maybe it's time to take this title away from DICE? Because there's probably not much left of this company today.

This game still has it's fair share of problems and DICE really needs to pull their crap together with a hand full of things but the game is surprisingly fun. 

Pros:
- Wingsuits, Grapples, Portable shields, Trophy-systems, Player controlled rockets. These new gadgets are honestly pretty fun to use and can really help spice up the game, especially with countering hard to fight play styles like camping and vehicles.
- The weapon customisation mechanic is a godsend, even if it doesn't make the most sense (Converting an assault rifle to fire pistol cartridges in .1 of a second). But being able to switch from a sniper scope to a red dot at close range is so nice.
- A lot of the old fun stuff is still in the game, The guns feel nice, "Some" of the maps are pretty decent, the Tornado is cool
- Robot dog 

Cons:
- The hero esc system is terrible, a blank, nameless soldier from something like battlefield 1 or 4 has way more interesting depth and personality then any of this games cringe ass cast, Just remove them dice.
- These different characters also remove that teamwork from the game, Medics have at least become more common but no one resupplies ammo and just about every class can use snipers or DMR's
- DMR's
- No vehicle launching
- Some of the maps are just so underwhelming or plain bad. There are like two ship yard maps. 
- Ontop of that the destruction is still a let down, The Tornado and Rocket were great but where are more of those game altering events? I wanna see skyscrapers fall, maps flood, Storms ravish the entire land in a hurricane or earthquakes split apart the earth. Yet we can't even have a small shack fully collapse?

I requested a refund for three purchases of in-game credits, but Steam did not refund the credits, but instead issued a refund for the Battlefield 2024 game. Stop refunding the game and request a credit refund!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

[h1] Battlefailed 2042. [/h1]

So much potential, wasted. The fictional 2042 era would have been a great base for a great Battlefield title that would have redeemed itself from the failure of Battlefield V. Just when we thought they couldn't get any lower, they proved us wrong.

Despite the persistent updates that made good on getting this game to some what mediocre levels if compared to Battlefield 3 & 4 and others before it, there are still some glaring issues with this game. Plus, all that time updating this game, if this game released in a better and complete state, it could have been proper additional content instead of 80-90% just fixes and lackluster content that we have now.

Things that are notable, good, & bad:
- Hero shooter elements / template seems to be heavily inspired and applied into this game. The stupid specialists reflect that.

- [b]NO MORE FACTION SPECIFIC PLAYER CHARACTER MODELS.[/b] Excluding portal, enemy character models are the same as you and your team. This should never persist in games like this.

1. It KILLS the IMMERSION. Might as well scrap the "US vs. RUSSIA" faction FFS.
2. Confuses friend from foe identification
3. Relying on just the UI and stupid light bars attached to character models which RED = ENEMY and BLUE = FRIENDLY is dumb.
4. Lore-wise: Jarring to see IRIS can side with the Russians in multiplayer. Given his story in BF4 he lost a friend to the Russians and is a loyal soldier to the US. 
5. The overall look of these specialists and their dialogue is generally cringe. Especially when you compare it to BC2, BF3, and BF4 player models and their dialogue.

The hell is this trend nowadays? even WW3 does this dumb design decision.

- [b]AI character models[/b] look better than player character models and yet those are the ones I want to play as not these CRINGE "SPECIALISTS." In previous titles, those are the character models. You play as an unnamed soldier, a part of a large military force against another military force. We could still have no-pats and have it structured like that but yet NOOOO EA decides: HERO SHOOTER-like characters with backstories and sell cosmetics cause that's the trend. SMH.

- [b]Cosmetics/Skins[/b] - many (not all, since some are decent) lean toward these bright cartoony and gaudy themes just like CoD and the trends of today. I miss the times when games like this actually stuck with the theme the devs intentionally portrayed. Serious, tactical, plausible military equipment and gear. Cartoony stuff are few and in between and mostly just for easter eggs or for fun. But not enough to detract from the immersive experience.

- [b]Vehicles[/b] - You have some helicopters that take 2 shots to blow up with your AT launcher. Used to be so effective in great previous titles. It's hard enought to shoot highly maneuverable flying vehicles, they shouldn't take 2 shots to blow up using dumb fire launchers and reward you for such skillful play. Gone are the proper IFVs, MRAPs too. At least tank gameplay is relatively fun but it still could have been better like in BF4. Can't say much on aircraft since I don't use it often. However vehicles models do look amazing and well done especially in most of the cosmetics. At least there no pink-cartoony flavored crap like in CoD.

Also each faction use the same vehicle models except for tanks, helicopters & jets. There are no more faction specific vehicle models in common transports, AA, and light vehicles. Again, this is similar to the character specific models problem. It seems lazy how each faction don't have their respective vehicles anymore. Whereas in BF3 & 4 or other titles, the Transports, AA, and light vehicles are different for each faction. It's so easy to disinguish from a distance if they're an enemy or not. Not having to rely on some UI.

- [b]Destruction[/b] - A DOWNGRADE from previous titles. They showcased a highrise building loosing a chunk of its side getting hit or blown up back then and yet that improved destruction is no where to be found. BF4 had levolution that changed how the map played for good or bad. Bad Company 2's destruction was tactical and not just for show. BF V introduced foritfication. A nice contrast from a totally destroyed map. Here? a step down and then we have gimmicky tornadoes.

- [b]Maps & Portal[/b] - Badly implemented and designed that they used so much time just to rework them. Time that could have been instead used to add more well designed maps and increase variety. BF Portal meanwhile is left in the dust. Can't say much in Hazard Zone cause like the name, I'd rather avoid it due to how bad they've handled this game.

- [b]Audio[/b] - Weapon audio don't feel as powerful compared to previous titles. I mean, it is mostly acceptable but lackluster if compared to titles like Bad Company 2 to BF4 and maybe BF1, the sound effects in those games were a joy to hear. Almost cinematic at times when there is full of action around you.

Overall, it is just slim pickings in the AAA FPS multiplayer side of gaming nowadays. If you're gonna buy this, just buy it on a huge SALE DISCOUNT just like I did. There is some fun in the game but it is still disappointing even with all the seasonal updates. Because it makes you realize, all that time EA and the devs used to fix this game, should have been time to ADD more proper content than what we currently have now if they only released this game in a PROPER STATE, CONSISTENT THEME & DIDN'T STRAY AWAY FROM A PROPER BATTLEFIELD IDENTITY.

The intro sucks balls, and it felt like there was an attempt to build atmosphere on the end of the world climate scenario, but there just isn't any atmosphere other than minor future tech n some tornadoes. It's classic USA vs Russia in a nearby end of the world due to the environment. So what better way than to kill each other over the remaining 'resources'? It's pretty dumb, ngl. 

The 'classes' are more dynamic, with more perks. Making the game play more interesting than in previous titles. You can be any role and have effectively any weapon. Wanna be a recon with an SMG / LMG / shotgun & C4? Go for it. You just can't have a rocket launcher, that'd be silly. 

The vehicles are a little OP, so I prefer playing on servers without them, or 'portal' 32v32 conquest. the 64v64 conquest with vehicles is absolutely mental. Prepare to die, and lots of explosions. 

Spotting: whenever you kill someone, you're effectively spotted immediately, making camping hard, and running around even harder.

Personally, my favs in order is BF4, BF42, then 1, then 5... then 3. So judge whatever way you want to.

There is so much I don't even know where to start. TO ITS CORE this game was never going to be good. The game's net code is proven laggy and buggy (frequently drops hits, etc.) and some people even think that the STILL unfixed (after 2 years) mouse input problems are because the SERVER SIDE handles input or that the mouse input is ported to console input. This game is just bad. The guns aren't balanced, the specialists aren't balanced, the maps aren't balanced, don't look pretty, and don't even function. And the developers still haven't produced enough content. One prevailing problem with this game is you just get bored. The developers do not care. They keep on making bad decision after bad decision and yet they still keep going on, ignoring community feedback, and banning streamers who disagree with them. The only hope for battlefield fans is the next game in the franchise - If it flops, the series is over. And the future doesn't look bright. If you are more interested in the vast array of problems, bugs, bad decisions, and mishaps relating to this game I recommend you check out the community discussion page on the forums. Just PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE don't buy it. Save your money for something worth it - a bottle of canned air has more value than this disgrace to my hard drive.

I spent a decent amount of time with BC2, BF3 and BF4 back in the day. While playing BF2042, I don't feel the atmosphere I'm used to from previous games in this series. The weapons feel like toys with almost zero recoil and too much effectiveness at long ranges. You can literally duel a dude with a sniper rifle far from you while wielding an SMG.
Introducing specialists is a completely incomprehensible decision for me. The parties in the conflict are theoretically Russia vs USA, but on both sides are representatives of completely different nations fighting against each other? The fuck is going on here? Besides, what's the point of dividing players into classes and specialists if everyone can use any damn weapon in the game without restrictions? I see no other explanation for this change other than pure greed from EA and the desire to sell skins for these cringe fortnite heroes. Of course, you can't create a game without a shitty Battle Pass these days. In the past, only planes, helicopters and possibly paratroopers could fly over your head in Battlefield games. Now you look up and see a whole squadron of non-binary specialists gliding your way and sniping you on the fly.
Even 2 years after its release, the game gives the impression that it was supposed to be something completely different before its release. The shooting system looks like homework that your friend named Call of Duty gave you and told you to change it up a bit so the teacher (us players) wouldn't notice.
Despite all the issues I mentioned, the game is actually fun, well, as a no-brainer FPS of course not as a Battlefield game. Luckily I bought the game on sale for pennies and I feel sorry for every fan of the series who was fooled by EA's sweet words at the premiere.
It's sad to see famous series like Battlefield, Assassin's Creed, Diablo, Call of Duty and Halo fall from grace under pressure of greedy developers.
My prior experience was the beta and it was not very enjoyable. However, the game is in a great state, performs well, and is a blast to play. I highly recommend it.

I don't usually write game reviews, but here I can't pass it up.
I started my acquaintance with the Battlefield series with Bad Company 2 and Battlefield 3. I will truly remember Battlefield 3, because for me it was an absolute masterpiece in all aspects of shooter. And how many evenings my friends and I killed on Noushehra Channels and it's scary to remember ahah.
When the next parts came out (Battlefield 4, 1 and 5), I didn't listen to anyone and quietly played them, and they still had the atmosphere of large-scale battles, the feeling as if you were really at war. 
And now 2 years after the release of Battlefield 2042 I decided to try it out and I will say that this game is not Battlefield. Don't get me wrong, I believe that in its current state the game is a solid 6 out of 10. But if you are looking for the exact or at least the same experience that was in the previous series - pass it by, this game is not for you.
Lots of colorful skins, stickers on weapons, strange phrases from soldiers, inarticulate mechanics of weapon classes and lack of recoil on almost all weapons - many people say that this part has taken a step backwards. I will say that it took a step back from the audience it has been gathering for decades and took a step forward to the zoomers and Fortnite. 
Hopefully EA won't continue down this path though.

I played BF1 a lot and just bought this for 10 bucks, it's a no-brainer.

BF1 is full of cheaters and the regular players are >50% pro's. You need at least 50 hours to get decent (1:1) scores and then still things happen you don't really understand. The photogrammetry in BF1 is outstanding and I still think it looks (and runs) a lot better than BF2042 though.

But the multiplayer experience for 36 year old after-work casuals like me ... is way better in BF2042 than in BF1.
More servers, better matchmaking, more interesting stuff happening.

The operators are NOT like "hero shooters", that claim is just ridiculous.
I hate hero shooters because of what they are.
I like even battlefields with everyone (or at least every team) having the same options to choose from, like CS which I play since 1999. 
The operators bring more variety through "perks" but that's it. I actually quite like it because some of them benefit my playstyle.

Conclusion: Buy it in sale.

I've played every battlefield game and this is by far the most disappointing. It had so much potential to be a great game but instead it has, in my opinion, failed.

I'll start with the pros:
- Sound design - not too bad but room for improvement

Cons:
- Game feels empty: no campaign, and it feels like its missing a lot of features.
- Gun play just feels stale: all the guns feel relatively similar. At the moment, assault rifles are the only viable option and feel completely unbalanced.
- Server stability - this could be an issue on my end although I'm on Ethernet with a 100mb download but I get a lot of stuttering and packet loss as well as server performance warnings.
- Progression feels grindy and one dimensional. Just getting kills to unlock skins and attachments.
- Map design is poor. Very large maps in some cases that just feel empty most of the time.
- Black screening - Seems like other people have had this issue but it's very frustrating.

I would not recommend this game in its current state. Definitely don't buy this at full price as it will be a massive waste of money. EA, if you're reading this, please just make more of an effort. It's okay to take 5 years to make a game and for it to be whole and actually work, but not okay to take 2 years and release an unfinished game that you have to pay more and more to get the whole thing and wait for 3 years for it to be finished anyway. Do better please.

I really didn't enjoy this game on launch, but as of Oct 2023, it's dratically improved itself, and can definitely keep up with the best of the Battlefields. This comes from an avid fan of 1942, Desert Combat, Bad Company 2.

[h1]Very CPU heavy, minimum specs will not run the game.[/h1]
Also, by default it is configured to use 16 threads even if your CPU doesn't have 16 available, that sucks, and you have to manually fix it with a cfg file.

Besides that the game is very fun to play, fast paced and the "hero" system isn't bad at all, small perks that aren't too game changing.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]How to fix the multithreading issue[/h2]
Place a file called [b]User.cfg[/b] in the game folder with the following (replace X with the number of threads available in your CPU):
[code]
Thread.ProcessorCount X
Thread.MaxProcessorCount X
Thread.MinProcessorCount 0
[/code]
By the way, changing those through the game console will not have effect, it seems to load those when the game launches

In short:

- AI needs serious improvement
- Elevator is bugged to the point where you can see through the building walls spotting all enemies in the area when going up (can't tell if that's the case when you go down)
- Although it's fun to flip the EBAA Wildcat upside down with a tank and basically suffocate it, but I think there must be some level of a more appropriate collision mechanic involved
- The operator Lis is unplayable after launching 1 rocket in the air. I looked it up and found posts about this issue and seems like it was discovered since the launch day
- Lots of other bugs that EA DICE likes to hide under the rug and ignore completely

Sidenote: do not buy this game at its full price, it should be dirt cheap considering game's current state. I got it for 10 euros and it's worth the amount imo. If you don't have 70 euros to spend, better play older titles.

Trust me. It's bad.

If you like consistently being spawned directly in the line of sight of enemies, often bordering on having your ass within 2 feet of them, hit registration so poor that you can unload an entire magazine into an enemy with only 20 points of damage registering, getting sniped in two hits with a pistol from 200m away by an enemy who doesn't even have a line of sight on you, map design with zero flow and thus forced 360 degree combat at all times, mechanics that are borderline cheating allowing players to grapple hook all over the map like it's a jungle gym, spotting that works roughly 50% of the time on a good day, vehicles made of cardboard, about 75% of the game being locked behind paywalls leaving you with only the most useless weapons in the game unless you hand over more money, random lag spikes, at least one hacker per game, and an overall play structure that makes an amateur airsoft match feel fair, then this is the game for you!

Battlefield 2042 returned to the true Battlefield sandbox and only in Battlefield moments after two years of updates and fixes and listening to the community feedback.


So what are the Pros and Cons ?

-Pros:

1) Visibility is good and maps look and play much better now after the rework.

2) The return of class system made the game much better.

3)Wide ranges of game modes (because of portal logic editor)

4)Weather conditions and tornadoes

5) Conquest 128 now feels fun and great (after two years of maps rework and class system rework)

6) Air Vehicles are fun to fly now.

7) The increasing of amount of vehicles, made it more enjoyable and increased the only in Battlefield moments

8) Movement is good. But I don't like the first-person running animation.

-Cons:

1)Only one new map each season. We only got 6 maps in two years of content which is ridiculous compared to other titles. In BF4/BF3 we got 8 new maps in first 4 months and after two years we got 20 NEW MAPS and A LOT OF WEAPONS.

2) Each season update, we don't know if the game will continue or will get canceled. DICE/EA didn't give the community any road map for the game since the launch.

2) Audio ... I am not talking about footsteps sounds ... I am talking about the sound of bullets, explosions, air vehicles when they become close to you and all sounds in general ... they are not good and don't meet battlefield standards ... old battlefield titles have a much better audio ... this is important because it makes you feel like you are in war ... look at BFBC2 audio or BFV Audio for example.... they make you feel like in a war. They fixed a lot of things and the audio is much better now compared to launch but still not as good as BFV/BFBC2/BF4. Just listen to the weapons sounds, all of them sounds the same. Listen to the shotgun sound and you will know what I mean.

3) amount of weapons and customization... the weapon customization is not that advanced ... it is better than BFV for sure but it is now on BF4 level of customization (2013 title) but with LESS OPTIONS ... I expected MW level of customization for 2021 title.

4) Air vehicles ... there are not that many customization options for them.... so little options (even less than BF4 customization options ) ... the ECM and TV missile are missing ... there are zero options for the gunner in heli ... etc.

5) Lack of destruction for almost all maps compared to other titles such as BFV,BF4,BFBC2


- mixed
1)Specialists. In my opinion, they don't work well in a Battlefield game.
2)There are not that many vehicles in game (air and land). BFV (WW2 game) has much more options for air and land vehicles. Where is the attack jet? Where is the LAV?


- I used to defend the game and I have been playing it since Closed Beta. I admit that they fixed a lot of things and game is much much better than before. The performance is much better. Everything looks great. But now, after spending the previous months fixing the game and reworking the launch maps, they still release only one new map per season. In the current season which will be running for 4 months and we got only one map... And there is no road map or official communication if the game will continue for season 7/8 or it will be canceled like BFV and SWBF2

- Because of lack of new content compared to other titles and lack of communication regarding the game future... I don't recommend this game.

I will keep playing the game from time to time because it is the only game now that offers true-sandbox Battlefield experience. In my opinion, even in worst years of Battlefield history, no other game can compete with battlefield in terms of All-Out-Warfare games.

Update: Came back to this game after a few years to see what changed, apparently I didn't wait long enough.

Battlefield 2042 offers a unique and enjoyable experience, particularly for fans of large-scale warfare. The gameplay is engaging, earning a solid 6 out of 10. It strikes a good balance between tactical team play and fast-paced action, although it doesn't quite reach the heights of some competitors.

Graphics-wise, the game impresses with its detailed environments and dynamic weather effects, deserving a 7 out of 10. The attention to visual detail enhances the immersion, though there is room for improvement in character animations and some textures.

The multiplayer aspect, a staple of the Battlefield series, is good but not groundbreaking, meriting a 6 out of 10. While it offers vast maps and intense combat, it falls a bit short when compared to the refined mechanics and pace of Call of Duty titles.

A notable downside is the lack of a single-player campaign. This absence is felt, especially for those who appreciate a narrative-driven experience in their games.

In conclusion, Battlefield 2042 is worth trying out, especially for those who enjoy large-scale multiplayer battles. However, instead of an outright purchase, I recommend opting for a subscription service to play the game. It's a great way to experience what the game has to offer without a long-term commitment, making it a good choice for a temporary gaming adventure.

Paid $10 for this game, which sounds about right given the still remaining graphical issues like a specific sight suddenly causing the gun to unload for the entire match. I was experiencing a bug where every 3rd match or so, the game would boot back to the usual menu but have a black screen and effectively soft lock. This is a PC issue that has been around since the launch of the game and the only solution is to Alt + F4 and try again until it happens again. I've only played for about 16 hours and I wanna say every hour had at least one of these, with a slow over 2 minute long log in process since it has to boot through EA and then check for anti cheat and then load shaders and then load the game. 

I've been told by friends that the operators are a lot less obnoxious with voice lines now, so I basically just pick them based on what skill I like using. Weapons can be used by anyone with the exception of sub weapons like anti tank rockets or C5. It's not as big a genre-defining issue like before with the return of ammo and medic bags, but I can still see why it doesn't feel the same as what previous battlefield players wanted. 

Not to mention you have the now-usual AAA crap of a dozen new shiny bundles to buy packs for smack in the middle of your notifications along with an extremely tedious battle pass if you expend the week 1 to WEEK THIRTEEN missions too quickly (and you will, they're simple things like blow up enemies or kill enemies). A battle pass that includes *new weapons*, might I add. Not just cosmetics. Even if I had zero technical issues and zero issues with the gameplay, this shop is almost as bad and obnoxious as free mobile games and I cannot ever recommend based on that alone. It does not deserve the respect.

I cant even play the game, I have tried Every single fix to crashes and complete pc shut offs when launching and just trying to play the game. Just to name a few

- Disabling Fullscreen Optimizations
- Updating Graphics Drivers
- Disabling / Adding an exception for the game in my anti malware software
- Running the game as Admin
- Running in Windows 7, and 8 compatibility
- Killing the Ea app thru Task Manager, and then launching the EXE file only
- Closing any apps that may take up a lot of usage, ( I.e Discord, or Spotify ) before launching
- Launching from steam ( which is where I own the game )
- Launching from Ea app ( Not where I own the game, therefore I can't verify the files on there )
- Verifying the game files on steam ( All Files were validated )
- Checking my overclock settings
- Not clicking into the game until the menu screen
- Closing VALORANT Vanguard anticheat
- Running the BF2042Launcher.exe File
- Changing my video settings thru NVIDIA because I wasn't sure if my GPU was spiking ( I have a 3080 ti )
- Unplugging unnecessary USB ports in my pc
- Disabling Steam Overlay
- Disabling Ea app Overlay

And honestly, there's probably a few more I forgot I even did. 

If you're curious about my PC and its specs compared to the Recommended specs, here they are :

CPU : AMD Ryzen 9 5900X 12 Core Processor 
GPU : NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3080 ti
RAM : 32 GB 3200MHz ( Only 2 slots used as if that matters )
PSU : 1000W Corsair Power Supply

And last of all that matters is that my game is downloaded on an SSD with 2 TBs total, and 1.24 TBs free.

In my opinion, I would play this game, and probably like it. But for the $60 price, don't try to buy the game, if you run into crashing issues like this in the future, you will 1,000,000% regret your purchase. There's no who or what about it. Just ONLY BUY THIS GAME WHEN IT GOES ON SALE BELOW $20.

I will be Editing this review if you are interested, but as for right now. The game is unplayable for me, even on my pc. My regards go out to anyone else that also has these problems when trying to the play the fucking that they paid for. Thank you for reading, and try the fixes above if your game will not stop crashing no matter what. Maybe some day it will work. Bye bye now.

I started playing battlefield 2042 during a time that I had been out of gaming, I really liked the sandbox-ish style to it all and just to experiment with whatever works moving forward.
I found the game easy to get into and I really liked the presentation and the soundtrack is really great!

A downside for me was the pricetag, though I think the game makes up for it with the amount of content available. I just bought it on sale. Another problem I had with the game was how certain classes were changed to the point where I pretty much ended up losing interest. There was a character with three types of grenades that also has a wingsuit. They removed two of the grenades and also made the sticky grenade launcher thing a lot less effective.

Sometimes I think balancing done to games goes a bit too far when the developers decide to remove equipment entirely. You chose to release the game with these options and it's fine to downscale them a bit but removing it is just a lazy solution and I don't feel like you have the playerbase in mind when you make such a decision.

All this could just be a matter of taste for me though, but I'm choosing to write about it as it did affect my reason for continuing to play. However that being said I had a good time playing the game and this might not be an issue for you at all. :)

So I pre-ordered this game when it came out. Was a big mistake. Took forever to get anywhere near playable and they refused my refund multiple times. So I was stuck with it. Fast forward to now and while it is playable I don't like it. Here's why. 

Operators... I can't stand them. They don't shut up. The" customization " is only what you can buy in the shop. There isno story so good luck caring what their bio is and where they are from. Did I mention they never shut up ? Yeah they are annoying and they look awful. Not tactical. Not realistic. Just fortnite tactical. * visible disgust * 

Maps.. They are boring. I don't feel like much time or thought really went into them. They are just meh. Nothing like 4, 3, or BC2. Just boring lifeless and lacking the destruction you want. Which if you were expecting battlefield style destruction you will be disappointed. There isn't any... 

Weapons. Gun play is still lacking in my opinion. Some attachments do the exact same thing but look different and the only plus I found unlike call of duty was they allow you to have a round chambered. The way it should be. 

Micro transactions... Pretty self explanatory. Anything remotely cool looking or better camo is locked behind a pay wall... Modern gaming strikes again. 

Censorship. Even though you are an adult playing a mature game apparently you can't handle words and any and all curse words are censored. Really weak.

I question whether this game is worth the 9 bucks I spent on it. I came in with low standards and I still feel myself slightly disappointed.

The game is still riddled with bugs, there is nothing particularly original or groundbreaking about the game (swapping attachments mid combat is the only new and maybe positive thing i'm seeing here). The gimmick with natural disasters occurring during the match is laughable, I've never seen a more harmless natural disaster in my life, you have to intentionally jump into the middle of a tornado then either wingsuit or parachute out with no consequences. You can wingsuit from a 40 story building face first into the ground at 200mph and you take like 40/100 points of damage. Jet physics are straight out of a cartoon, they're floaty and hovery with incredible control despite being the wrong type of jet to have anything close to that type of control. Maps are mediocre, the agent system is dreadful, every battlefield that came before this did better with the class system. Its almost impossible to identify enemy footsteps considering all the loud pointless random shit taking up all the audio(natural disasters). You can't shoot through walls, the destructibility of buildings and the environment is laughable because I remember being able to destroy more in battlefield bad company (released 15 years ago). Overall this is exactly what I would expect from EA, but hey they mostly fixed hit reg, so there's that.

Don't buy at full price. I bought this on mega-sale before season 4, so that's something to keep in mind in comparison to other reviews. Granted, no battlefield game in my experience has EVER been a complete game on release.

Pros:
Still was pretty buggy at first, but those have been resolved for the most part within the last year. I don't get the black screen of death that many others have. I think game play is good, but I can see how other BF vets would think differently. WAY more guns than the early seasons from what I've heard. The ability to change weapon accessories on the fly is neat and the reworks done throughout seasons 4-6 have progressively made the game better. I also like the specialists (unpopular opinion), but it does bring some more essence to the game than just guns and vehicles. Certain specialists are overall better than others, but you can find a niche role for underused specialists to have an advantage, especially if you run a squad with friends.

Cons:
I wish there were more maps and/or maps with more "je ne sais quoi" like the preceding games. Still can't fly a helicopter to save my life. EA = micro transactions. The sweats in this game are ridiculous.

Probably still a better option than MW3, Destiny, etc. Not as much fun as BF1, but better than 5, and I still come back to play regularly. 7/10
Games good, pretty much solid now. Don't know why EA destroyed Battlefields reputation though but eh life goes on.

Battlefield 2042 offers a mix of futuristic combat scenarios and large-scale battles, characteristic of the franchise. The game introduces new maps, vehicles, and weapons, aligning with its 2042 setting. However, it is facing challenges with server stability, bug issues, and player satisfaction regarding gameplay mechanics and content variety. Overall, the experience might vary for players, with some finding the high-octane action thrilling, while others might miss the depth and polish of previous installments. Personal enjoyment may greatly depend on individual expectations and tolerance for technical imperfections.

The game has very little to do with the older classics that made this series popular. 
Firsly, adding specialists and customizable character skins, not only makes the game look uglier and out of place, but also makes visual identification of enemies harder. Its annoying to have to look for the blue marker over ones head, before you start shooting at them. 
  The gadgets, and the fact that you can pick any weapon with any class make the battlefield pure insanity. Its silly how one man can carry a launcher, a sniper rifle, and a big gadget, all without popping his kneecaps whenever he jumps. It also makes the game unbalanced, and a few classes unplayable.
  The removal of the suppresion effect was one of the bigger mistakes Dice made. Rather than tactical positioning and covering before firing, now gunfights mostly consist of eratic movement and quickly scoping on the enemy. Positioning has very little impact. Now gynplay reminds more of the poorly designed battle royal titles that are so widespread nowdays, and that Dice tried so hard to model its game after.
  The supersonic bullets create a shockwave around them as they fly. The gasses expanding out in front of the barrel, after firing, also create a much stronger shockwave. When these shockwaves hit soldiers they have a concusive effect. And that, coupled with the sharpnel of closeby hitting bullets and the fear of death create an actual suppresion effect. Battlefield was one of the first series to introduce this effect, and it was very realistic.

For all it's flaws, and despite the fact that it's EA.... this is actually a really good game. No, I'm not joking. At the time of this writing, the game is 84% off on the Autumn sale of 2023 - absolute steal. The game is tight and responsive.  The gunplay feels great. Yes, there's no campaign, which is why it's not worth the $80 asking price. But for $11 or so, this is a legitemately exceptional mutliplayer experience. (you can also skirmish vs bots if you want to lvl up your profile/test new weapon loadouts). This franchise regularly gets a lot of criticism, which I understand.. but this time around, the game itself really is good. Hackers dont seem to have taken over just yet, unlike in BFV which is completely unplayable now. Im sure it will happen eventually, but for now it's fine. Im not being sarcastic - this game is really fun. One of the better battlefield games, now that the issues have been ironed out.

This game made me want to gronk spike a baby in rage. First off the spawn system is absolutely abysmal. You will have numerous encounters where enemies will spawn like a few yards around you and immediately dust you. The gun fighting in this game is absolutely cheeks as well, especially compared to battlefield 4. You will almost always lose a 1v1 to anyone with a faster rate a fire even if your gun does more damage per round. Your marine handles recoil like a toddler holding a leash with a pitbull  attached to it. Dont get me started on the fact that it takes like 10-15 rounds too eliminate a player especially at further ranges. Your AR has like .00000001 percent chance of actually killing a player if they are more than 30 yards, unless they have no health or are SpeD. By the time you fire your gun they can simply chimp around and hide behind the one rock that everyone else is huddled behind. There is no hardcore mode that I could find either which is stupid af. Alot of players enjoy being able to down an enemy in a few realistic shots. The music in this game is horrendous and listening to it just about gave me up left and right syndrome to go with my down. You'd be better off having a live glock go off next to your ear then listen to the theme. 3/10 absolutely cheeks. The only thing that is good is the graphics thats about it. I guess for 10 bucks its whatever, but I would have rather spent that on a big mac then this.

New Review:
BF2042 is good.

I have never refunded a game so fast in my life. I REALLY wanted to like this game, even a little bit since I have a friend that plays this and I don't normally play shooters online, but was excited to co-op with a friend. I even got this game at a REALLY high discount, but it was just a horrible experience. Maybe it's different for people that have played other Battlefield games before and know the mechanics and how the game works, but I had zero experience with any previous titles before this one, and it was the most frustrating game I have ever tried to play. 

There is no tutorial AT ALL. None. ZERO. The very start of the game drops you into one of the game modes and just tells you to go attack enemy posts or defend your team's post. Absolutely NO instructions on what buttons do what, or how to do anything. The game encouraged me to get in a tank/vehicle and do a few different things. Great, but HOW??? What button do I push? What do I need to do in order to complete the task you are suggesting? I'm not the kind of guy that needs my hand held thru a game, but at least the BASIC instructions would be good for those of us that aren't military shooter vets.

If you ARE a military FPS vet, I'm sure you likely skip any tutorials any newer game may have, but some of us need the basics at the start so we can get the feel for a new game, especially for gamers like me that don't play tactical shooters, but wanted to give it another try.

Not only did I hate this game, but it left such a bad taste in my mouth, I don't know if I will give ANY military FPS games another shot any time soon.

Battlefield 2042 is a sandbox shooter that prioritises role based infantry game-play, vehicle game-play and playing the objective. Would be great to see this game have continued support for another year as I have been an avid player since Season 2.

New additions such as the specialists give unique traits, specialist gadgets and class gadgets to every playable character. The plus system defines firearms combat as it allows for on the fly attachment swapping. The new maps are some of the most beautiful, amazing and unique levels in any multiplayer shooter game. New modes such as Hazard Zone, Control and Uplink are very fun but also tie into the games unique narrative.

Great game, lots of fun environments. I've sunk some time into this game and there will always be things in Battlefield games that ruffle my feathers, but there's so much offered in this game that I can't say it ruins the experience. Risks were taken with specialists and they keep the game fresh, helicopters are a nightmare but what else is new. The game has immensely improved since launch. There's still a need for more content (more maps!) but ultimately the experience has been worth it and fun. 2042 goes on sale often and is absolutely worth grabbing when on sale. The internet is a grumpy place that's hard to satisfy, so take it all with a grain of salt.

I've played BF2042 across three stints: release, late 2022/early 2023 and autumn 2023.  The game has had a solid redemption arc.  It's not perfect, but feels more in line as a BF experience as of this writing.

Gunplay: 7/10.  Large assortment of weapons, I enjoy the gunplay for the most part.  Balance is a challenge - new weapons added are almost always overtuned.  There are also a number of "portal" weapons, classic weapons from prior BF titles, which I found uninteresting and only there for leveling up.  

Class/Squad play: 6/10.  The character+archetype style was poorly received, and at launch it did detract from squad play, since there were a couple overtuned characters and everyone could use anything.  This has been adjusted quite a bit into more of the classic archetype kits, but there are still some characters that are substantially more useful/powerful than others.  Squads now feel more impactful, at least.

Maps 4/10.  I primarily play Breakthrough, and the maps are the weakest part of the game.  Several of the launch maps have been reworked and these reworks have helped, but the seasonal maps tend to be poorly balanced as well.  The lack of impactful environmental destruction also is a bummer - not a lot of buildings to bring down vs previous BF titles.

After 313 hours of leveling up the attachments, weapons, vehicles and etc. Today on 27/11/2023 the Devs decided to stop adding bots to the solo experience and that's where I go to relax and chill, Now time to uninstall and move on. Do I recommend this game? For 78-84% on sale, Absolutely. Full price? Not even close. There are still really annoying bugs from launch day, let's put it that way. They capped the leveling for the attachments, weapons and vehicles on solo/coop and the rest have to be leveled up in normal matches. That's fine and understandable but removing the 128 player game mode on solo and portal was breaking the promise to give 128 player game modes that they pitched and promised since launch day. If anyone who buys this game right now is expecting to play 128 player game mode on solo,/coop with friends, I'm sorry but you'll be severely disappointed.

I enjoy this game, It is different from other battlefields but its still the classic battlefield game design. I have experienced no technical issues, but I know people personally that have (typical triple a experience in 2023). Overall this game is worth the price when its on sale.

As it stands, this game isnt worth the download even if it was free. It has been plagued by literally every issue imaginable and is lacking content wise in pretty much every department. Graphical glitches, random disconnects, inability to even join matches, progression bugs, terrible hit registration, and piss poor map design are just a few of the incredibly long list of issues the game is facing. Top that off with an abysmal amount of weapons, a blatant cashgrab battlepass, and easily some of the worst maps designed in the BF Franchise and you get this incredibly unpolished turd of a game. The fact that they shamelessly put a premium currency and paid pass into a game that is clearly not even close to finished really says a lot about the Devs and the Publisher. 

Maybe in the future DICE/EA will actually pull their heads out of their asses and make it fun, but as it is currently, I would absolutely recommend you refund or skip purchasing altogether.

This game had a very unstable release, and, to this day, the game is still in a laggy, glitch filled, nearly unplayable state. From enemies not rendering on-screen to the game reading keyboard inputs that aren't even happening, the only fun way to play this game is to play custom bot lobbies, resulting in you never actually leveling up or unlocking weapons. It had a lot of potential from the start, a futuristic Battlefield game focusing on high-speed movement mechanics with a largely expanded choice of classes for the player to use to their advantage, it could have easily been the best PvP shooter game to date, yet the devs refused to give it the care it deserved.

I played an hour or so of this game and then requested a refund. It didnt crash or anything in that short amount of time but I played a few online matches and honestly was raging so hard at how NOT Batllefield this game is become and how far from Battlefield 4 this is! One of the matches I played was just so saturated with vehicles that it was near impossible to spawn in and get a few shots off before being spammed with cannons from something nearby. I am honestly a die hard Battlefleld fan, have played many many hours of Battlefield 3 and 4, but this game spits in their faces and ruins the franchise for me which make very sad as Im sure alot of Battlefield fans are considering this game was released in 2021 and still is riddled with bugs/crashes. 

Cmon guys Battlefield used to be an awesome franchise, it was a pioneer in the open world style online shooters category and always had that over COD. But now it seems that now this game has been over manufactured so much that you have lost sight of the features and play style that the community wants when playing Battlefield! You have some good ideas in here but you changed the game for the worse and as I understand it have now lost most of your player base! 

If the Battlefield devs havent played Battlebit yet they definitely should, this game has given the players what you failed to do here and are reaping the benefits. Its far closer to what Battlefield should be than Battlefield itself! Even with Roblox graphics its still 100x more popular than Battlefield....

A little weary at first and held off because of the bad launch. Being on a huge sale after call of duty flopped was a no brainer.  Now I’m doing an easy 6hrs/day in breakpoint. Also scratches the insurgency itch in the AI mode a little but with better/more fun fun handling. It’s not as intense but you can use it to chill after some PvP before you go back.

Big pro - doesn’t feel like there’s any sbmm. If there is then it’s not noticeable. Makes the game enjoyable over longer periods.

Cons -
1). Don’t care for the specialist idea too much, however it is nice to be able to resupply your own ammo no matter what gun you have. I always liked throwing ammo boxes but now I’m not limited on certain gun types.

2). Futurism is eh. It’s not overdone to be immersion breaking and not feel like battlefield but it’s riding the line I think. Not bad but let’s no go too much further on the future or it will turn into call of duty and we will have laser guns.

3). Specialist outfits suck. I like to run full face helmets/coverings for some reason and I’m barely able to do that. Especially without trying to spend $20 for cosmetics which aren’t even that great to begin with. Character customization could use some love moving forward in the future. Not really much to work towards, just give me money or use a basic looking skin forever.

4). I don’t think it would be too bad if the specialists weren’t locked to certain roles. Nothing would make me happier than throwing ammo boxes to everyone while in a full ghillie suit + face paint.

Overall, fun game

I'll review BF Portal first because it's arguably the best part of the game:

Things I like:
- They FINALLY remastered the best bf title they came out with after 11 years (Bad Company 2) and rightfully so after the mess of a launch it has been for bf2042 with all of the bugs and unfinished/missing features.
- The maps, guns, vehicles, characters and overall feel of the game brings back the nostalgic feel that made me play Bad Company 2 more than any battlefield game I've tried.
- 1000 times better than any current battlefield in terms of the maps, guns, movement, destruction, graphics, map layout, map building aesthetics, vehicles, it just feels perfect as it did back in 2010 but with a fresh coat of paint and upscaled graphics
- Cross platform is incredible and makes it so that we actually have more people that we can play with and fill up servers with instead of playing against bots/npc's.

Things I don't like:
- The scoreboard no longer shows a veteran status number next to your name the same way like the original Bad Company 2 did. This is important. Why? Because you now no longer have a number indicating how many Battlefield games you have played in the past next to your name. In regular Bad Company 2, I had a 12 next to my name, meaning I played 12 Battlefield titles in the past and that actually meant something when others would look at it or me knowing that others can see that.
- The way that you select your attachments is the most un-intuitive process I have ever come across. To the point where I actually had to look up a tutorial on it. Bring back the same UI there was for the original Bad Company 2 to select your guns, attachments and gadgets.
- The fact that there are only 2 maps to play. Granted, yes they are pretty much the best BC2 maps they brought back, especially Arica Harbor, but PLEASE, bring back or upscale the rest of the Bad Company 2 maps. I will pay to get more maps to play on because it's so fun.
- The rest of the guns, gadgets, attachments, etc. are missing. It almost feels like they worked on a Bad Company 2 remaster and only brought back 2 maps as a test. Well don't have it as a test anymore, it is good. WAY BETTER than any of your base game modes or current Battlefields. Bring back the rest of the content that is missing from the original Bad Company 2.
- Being forced to hold down spacebar to die instead of how it was in the original Bad Company 2 where you are just dead and wait to respawn. WHO MADE THIS HORRIBLE FEATURE. GET RID OF IT. IT IS AWFUL. Why do I have to hold spacebar each time and watch my character squeal for his life? Just have me dead and if I happen to be revived before I spawn, SO BE IT. Just like the original, which was MUCH BETTER of a system.
- The way that you make callouts for ammo, etc. is way too intrusive. Covers whole screen and made me shoot an RPG at my self in front of a wall because of asking for ammo or health pack. Make it cover less of the screen or make it similar to how it was in Bad Company 2, where you just ask for ammo near a person who is assault.

Overall, it is VERY fun to play Bad Company 2 remastered again. I was still to this day playing the original Bad Company 2 with whatever servers were left and to be able to do this again, is truly satisfying and just fun. The fact that there is cross platform, is a godsend for getting more people to play with. Please, focus your efforts on the one good thing you put out with Battlefield 2042, which is a remaster of the games that were actually good. Bring back the rest of Bad Company 2 maps, the guns, attachments, gadgets, vehicles and the Onslaught and Vietnam expansion. The map I'd want back the most would be Oasis. (My favorite). Also, would be nice to at least see the maps Port Valdez, Isla Inocentes, Nelson Bay, Harvest Day. Rest of the maps were amazing too, but those especially, NEED TO be brought back.

Also, BF3 remastered, I would say everything as positively about it as with Bad Company 2 earlier. Obviously it's not as good as Bad Company 2, but it has it's own feel, jets are fun, guns are fun, the maps also bring back that nostalgia vibe and would be more fun if it had more than 2 maps.

AND, BF1942 remaster, I was pleasantly surprised. I had a ton of fun with it as I was a big fan of BF1943 and the visuals and scale/size of maps on BF1942 remaster is amazing. Very stunning visually, makes you feel like you're in a real war. The gameplay is fun and is awesome to play with a sniper from towers. Would HIGHLY suggest playing either one of these remasters as they are all very good.

In terms of BF2042, I honestly think it's very fun also and don't understand what these mainstream reviews are talking about. The game is incredibly good, yet you have this echo chamber of same people saying how bad it is, actually deterring people due to sheep mentality and most people being easily manipulated. Conquest mode is fun for me and I like the progression of unlocking guns. Sure it's missing some features and could use more gun & map selection but they already brought back the scoreboard and why are people malding over voip if Discord exists and most people use that? Now I have to worry about having to mute annoying people in game. The graphics are incredible unless you have a potato pc which most people do, the gunplay is fun, they made the map areas you fight in smaller, the vehicles are fun, BF Portal with Bad Company 2 and bf3 is incredible. And they did all of this while in lockdown during Covid. I'm actually curious as to whether these "reviewers" played the game more than 1 hour before giving these reviews and then AFTER QUITTING the game, continue to say how awful it is.

Overall, 8/10 and could potentially be a 9/10 if they polish up more, bring back missing features and end up bringing in more guns and maps for BF2042 and BF Portal's BC2 & BF3.

I will say that I got my moneys worth out of it in terms of playtime. But at the same time, the developers DICE have a monopoly on this "genre" and there's not much else like it. You gotta go play mil sim games if you want anything close to it, even then they'll often be missing aircraft. 

Its astounding just how much they screwed up on this game. And its not simple things to fix but issues baked into the game. The lack of veteran experience at the studio + the amount of developers who grew up on "CoD" like games is very evident. I'm not saying this to be mean, they're skilled developers. But it often feels like they fail to grasp the battlefield genre and don't understand how small changes can lead to big impacts. 

1. Specialists Design - The developers seemed like they designed this game with aiming at the CoD warfare/Apex crowd as their primary audience. There is a hyper focus on "selfish" gameplay styles. Where people choose loadouts that have minimal teamwork aspects. All they care about is guaranteed kills. While this may be ok in a game like CoD, this does not work in BF. Even as arcadey as BF is, teamwork is an integral part of it. And when you're basically telling your players "Be selfish and get 10x more kills with this loadout vs infantry", it really starts to screw up the experience as a whole. Ammo crates, med crates, reviving, spotting, anti vehicle rockets, repairing, marking targets, recon, squad beacons, etc. These all lend towards teamwork. And the devs designed the specialists in this game to heavily discourage running loadouts with those. As a result, you'll often see people complaining about things like lack of revives or vehicles being too powerful. Because everyone is running around with a selfish loadout because it gives them more guaranteed kills. 

2. Balance - Oh boy, balance. Specialist balance is horrible. If you're not running either Sundance, McKay, Lis, or Falyk; you're hamstringing your team. That's the simple truth. The devs have said they wanted some specialists with "niche" roles, but why? Why do that? Why not just balance the game so that specialists have a purpose all the time. You have sundance that can literally fly around, creating huge amount of issues. McKay which can traverse anything and zip around like that Apex robot character. You've got falyk who has infinite (but on a cooldown) self and ranged healing. You have Lis who has infinite (but on a CD) TV rockets that can cover half the map. Most people play the other specialist aside from these simply because of cosmetics.

3. Map Design - Even with all the reworks, map design is horrible. Take for example the snow map with the ice berg. One side gets a large iceberg they spawn ontop of. Which allows for them to easily parachute to every capture point on the map. Oh look, that side also has a consistently higher win rate! What a surprise. Throw in sundance flying around like a dive bomber destroying vehicles none stop and flanking none stop, you have a consistent crapchute. There's quite a few maps like this where one side has a noticeable advantage thanks to design. 

4. Asymmetrical design - they've bandaided this the best they could without reworks, but there are still asymmetrical balance issues that suck. Mainly around the attack helicopters and the transport helicopters. In both cases the RU side has an advantage. 

5. Vehicle balance - Because of the issues of #1, vehicle balance is all over the place. Since you would be LUCKY if you have more than 10% of your team actively trying to counter vehicles, they had to balance the vehicles to make them like paper. Where one person can easily kill them. So in a game where enemies can range from 32 players or 64 players on  one team, it only takes 1-3 of them to easily kill a tank. Nevermind you have sundances flying around none stop. And if you're ever in a game where a good amount of your team is countering vehicles. Like 25-30% of them...vehicles on the enemy team simply don't exist. They barely have a chance to do anything because of how effective they had to make anti-vehicle. Yet despite this, you still get people who whine because their McKay-C4 loadout can't counter a tank easily or helicopter. 

6. Snipers - They got nerfed hard. Like it or not, this is part of the BF formula. Snipers have always existed. Between TV missiles, tracer fire that looks like they copied the  code from battlefront 2, kill cams, modifable weapons on the fly, and scope glint; snipers are pretty useless now.

7. Lack of Stealth - If you fire a bullet without certain attachments, you get auto spotted on the map. Which is just horrible. The sound should be enough. You don't need to highlight enemies on the map when the fire a bullet. That was such an obvious handicap given to players who don't have sound on. You've got tons of gadgets that spot you. You also have a horrible killcam design where they show you the kill cam BEFORE you fully die. So if you kill someone, they get shown where you are. Then they get revived and boom, they know exactly where you are. They should have only shown you a kill cam AFTEr you have fully died. So you can't just get revived by an ally sitting prone and know exactly where the person who killed you is. Finally the game will automatically "highlight" enemies you're pointing at by showing their name in red above their head. So if  you're inside of a bush and someone running by has their cross hair move over your location. Even though you can't be seen at all thanks to t he camouflage, they'll still start firing like crazy into the bush. Not because they actually see you. They just see the floating red name and are aiming at that, not the actual person. 

8. Macros - They didn't do much to counter macros in this. So you've got people using single shots with insane accuracy + rate of fire. They get those mouses where you can program a macro into it to fire faster than what normal human input would allow you too. I don't know why they don't just put in a hard rate limit for these guns. You see a lot of single shots (both firemode and things like semi-auto snipers) firing way faster than they should. 

So if you're looking for a Battlefield game where nobody wants to use teamwork items, map balance is horrible, and the game has even less depth than previous Battlefields; this is the one for your. Sadly though there's nothing like it and its the only BF left with some kind of anti-cheat enforcement (looking at you Bf5). 

One thing this BF has shown is it laser focused on how badly things can go wrong. Next BF they release, I'm going to be watching VERY intently around loadout balance and map design. If we have another loadout issue with selfish loadouts, high mobility specialists, and bad map design; yah that next BF is going to be "wait till its on sale" for me. Not gonna go through another 3+ years of this.

Its a little hard to recommend this game (when its not on sale) because it started out real rough and only sort of recently has it really started to polish up and turn into something I think anyone looking for a "Battlefield" experience could jump into and have a good time in. There's still parts of it I don't like/think could be worked on a bit more but overall I think its not a bad addition to the series (in its current state). I only wish it started on the right foot so it didn't have to take so long to get here.

Something to consider if you are looking to buy the game (for those in the future) is if there's a current season going that can keep you occupied after you reach the level where you've unlocked all of the default guns, because frankly I don't see this game sticking it out for the long run after another installment in the series comes out (in its current state). The only way I can see it lasting is if Portal mode starts to have a more prominent role since its genuinely an interesting concept that I think could have a place in future installments. Portal could almost be a standalone game that gets added to/updated along with each new installment in the series. it could take on the current battle pass system to help produce some profit and keep the legacy of older games alive (RIP Bad Company 2 servers)

previous review: this game absolutely blows man like I knew when I bought this game I was signing up for huge maps but jesus christ these are like twice the size of the ones in battlefield V. I also dont know if this is a thing where soldiers in the future are like augmented or something to take more bullets but getting kills is super frustrating. It takes like 15 bullets with the m4 to kill a dude with no armour and if they do have armour you could probably empty your whole mag in the back of their head and they would be able to turn around and gun your down with their godly sub machine gun which brings me to the next point which is THE submachine gun. after you reach a certain level the second smg you get which is the bizon it becomes the only gun you will use because of its stupidly large mag and fire rate. there are also very few weapons with unlock levels spread apart quite far so that makes loadout variety a little slow and dry. game also has a habit of freezing and or crashing at random. Optimization is so bad that even the top gpus cant even run the game at 60fps. This game is NOT finished and you should probably give it some time before buying.

Since the Season 6 update dropped, Battlefield 2042 has undergone a total respawn – it's like the devs hit the reset button on the whole experience. The maps now feel meticulously balanced, creating an environment where every firefight is an exhilarating battle royale of wits and reflexes. The gunplay is as crisp as a headshot, with the new weapons adding a level of tactical depth that even the most seasoned players will appreciate. It's like they've unleashed a new meta, and I can't get enough of tweaking loadouts to find that perfect combination for dominating the leaderboards.

"However, it's not all sunshine and health packs. The occasional server lag can be a real buzzkill, interrupting the flow of an otherwise flawless match. It's like experiencing lag-induced déjà vu – you're sure you shot that enemy, but the server says otherwise. Additionally, the glitchy wall encounters have become an unexpected feature, turning me into an unintentional parkour enthusiast. Despite these occasional hiccups, Battlefield 2042 has become my go-to digital battleground, where every match feels like an epic raid, and the Season 6 update is the expansion pack we didn't know we needed. Respawning into this chaos has never been more addictive.

I like this, Season 3 is fun, but I had expected better from the franchise overall.
Update: Season 6 is better and it's finally where it should've been at launch.

I don't see why all the hate, Battlefield 2042 IS A GOOD GAME, yes it is buggy, yes it has a couple things to improve, but those are things that will get fixed up in time, people need to find some more patience these games are made in the worst of times. Played this for the past 2 days and I have experienced a couple bugs where you can't change your loadout at times when you respawn also I have at one time fell out of the map, the vehicles can be buggy at times, and there could be more secondary weapons as there are only 3 but like I said those things will improve. The explosion and  shooting mechanics are insane it looks great, the maps are huge but people seem to over exaggerate the fact that they're too big, no they are not, 30 seconds of running till you find action does not mean the map is too big, the maps in general are beautiful, only two modes but I think the thing that makes up for it is that you can play maps from bf2 bf3 and the very first one. That's a really nice touch to add, overall a really good game can't wait for it to improve.

Battlefield 2042 has come a long way since its initial release. 
Each update fixing some major issue, and sometimes bringing a new bug with it.

The graphics are great, the spatial sound is one of the best, most maps are somewhat balanced depending on the gamemode you play.

"Everybody" dislikes the specialists, but I like them. Depends on how you play, and your mindset.
When you're playing, you get some cool and awesome moments, followed by the dumbest/most underwhelming way to die.

I enjoy playing the game,
If you're looking for a great shooter that has plenty of action, then you should try it out.
The game feels like it has finally become what it should have been from the start.

Really hope DICE/EA don't fuck it up... 🤞

Battlefield 2042 offers an exhilarating and visually stunning first-person shooter experience that immerses players in the chaos of large-scale warfare. The game's vast maps and dynamic weather systems create a truly immersive battlefield environment, providing a sense of realism and unpredictability. The introduction of specialist classes adds diversity to gameplay, allowing players to adopt unique abilities and playstyles. However, the game has faced criticism for its initial lack of polish, with bugs, glitches, and server issues impacting the overall experience at launch. Additionally, the absence of a traditional single-player campaign disappointed some players who were hoping for a more narrative-driven component. Despite its initial setbacks, Battlefield 2042 has the potential to evolve into a top-tier shooter with future updates and improvements.

I Miss old Battlefield :(

Battlefield 2042 feels like a fever dream.
I had fun. Well, atleast with my friends. The game feels like a prototype of something much larger. It's missing most, if not, all the core-features that made the earlier battlefield titles so memorable & funny to play.
I have bought the gold edition, but it really feels like i bought the standard edition. There has been no updates, regarding the content to come in year 1, and the only thing we have gotten in the meantime is some skins and really underwhelming gamemodes.
The only exciting thing to happen since the launch of the game, was the introduction of the weekly missions. But that also turned out be extremely underwhelming after the first week.
Performance & graphical-wise, i think this is the lowest of lowest, in the battlefield series to date. I would almost call it "amateurish". Especially by the fact, that this is a AAA (Triple A) game.
The graphics has seen a big downgrade in comparison to Battlefield V and previous titles. The maps are large, but they also lack everything that made the previous battlefield maps interesting and funny to play on.
The whole aspect of specialits is extremely weird. The traditional four-class system has always worked well, but now it's been changed to having to choose and play a specific specialist out of 10 different ones?
To say the least, i don't the understand the reason behind the change. I'm not saying it's bad, but it really doesn't make sense on paper. Maybe it's due to wanting to have unique skins for every specialist? i don't know.
Something i would also like to comment on, is the gameplay.
It's fine. It's nothing special by any means whatsoever. It feels like a very generic first person shooter, and the guns are just fine enough to use. Some vehicles feel good to use. Some are good and some are bad.
The lore behind the game is actually really interesting and good, in my personal opinion. The whole world has gone to ♥♥♥♥ and WW3 is basically on the verge of happening. The reason why i am writing this however, is because this is pretty much nonexsistenst in the game, other than some item descriptions.
Instead, we have specialists who run around and say stupid & quirky ♥♥♥♥, especially towards the end game (looking at you Angel).
Right now, Battlefield V has more than double the daily steam players that Battlefield 2042 has. To say the least, i really don't much optimism for 2042's future. There is drama left and right, and there's even some speculation that the game will be cancelled by EA entirely. It almost feels like Anthem all over again, and that's not a good thing.

TL;DR:
Battlefield 2042 is disappointing, boring, buggy, poorly optimized and a waste of time, unless you have someone to play with + any editions above the regular one, feels like a scam in all honesty.
