Update 14 (Positive): Despite all the issues I've had, I realise that I've mostly enjoyed playing this game, not to mention I've spent 200+ hours playing it. The lows of this game were very low and I'm disappointed I didn't get to enjoy playing this game during the first half of my experience. However I can say beyond a doubt that after easily putting in 200 hours in this game (a rare occurrence for me) the $60 price tag has been worth it. Not sure if I'd recommend this game for people looking to purchase it this late, but I hope that the lessons learned during the development of this game will hopefully ensure the next release of Battlefield will be a success from launch. Please enjoy the rest of this review as a throw back to when this game was often unplayable.

Update 13 (Negative): After Season 6 update the game will no longer launch along with about 75-50% of other players. How do you not catch this in pre-launch testing, and how the hell is it not yet fixed? EA and DICE are an embarrassment to game development.

Update 12 (Positive):
I've decided to give the game a final positive review. DICE has shown significant commitment to making the game as good as they can. It still has severe flaws that need to be addressed, but I'm enjoying the game again regardless. Since migrating to a computer with a more powerful CPU I've experienced no issues (however by previous hardware should have been more that powerful to run the game properly so I believe the game is still in need of serious optimisation). If you're considering whether to buy the game or not, I'd say don't. DICE are reportedly working on the next battlefield game already so I think this game is already on it's deathbed. But more importantly I don't think EA or DICE deserve your money with the way they screwed up the launch of this game. Letting it fail is maybe what the franchise needs for EA and DICE to get their shit together and actually deliver a functional game on launch for once.

Update 11 (Negative):
Never mind, they did nothing to optimise the game. Anything with 64+ players is unplayable. Fuck you EA and fuck you DICE. I'd refund this game if I still could.

Update 10 (Positive):
Who would have known? They spent 5 minutes optimising the game and it's made a remarkable difference. Frame rate is not as stable as I'd like but it's acceptable and most importantly, playable. The new game mode "Shutdown" is loads of fun and the return of "All" chat is a welcome change. I've been very much enjoying my recent time playing this game. It seems the game is on a good path. However I just can't shake the feeling that as soon as the game is about to become a gem, it's just going to get abandoned as the devs and publishers move onto the train wreck that will be the next launch of a Battlefield game.

Update 9 (Negative):
1 Week, that's all I got. 1 week of actual smooth performance and enjoyable experience before we ended up right back to the crappy performance I've come to expect from a product by a multi billion dollar corporation such as EA. And then these assholes have the audacity to announce that they are working on a new (soon to be) train wreck of a Battlefield game. And before you think to your self "geez sounds like an issue with your computer". I suggest you take a look at the barren wasteland that is the EA forums, littered with people experiencing the EXACT same issue as me, with 0 responses from EA or DICE. Why is my powerhouse of a computer on a clean windows install suffering all these nonsensical performance issues? Why to I manually create a config file telling the game to use all CPU cores at it's disposal for the game to run smoothly (again, this solution only worked for a week)? Why do companies with such pathetic ethics and quality standards keep, not only, surviving as a company, but also keep pumping out these absolute shittastic games? 

Update 8 (Negative):
How does a Intel i7-9750H, a RTX2070 and 40Gb of ram only produce about 50-60 fps on High video settings (other video settings make no difference in performance)? I don't understand how an issue that countless people have been having since the game came out is still an issue today? It's embarrassing.

Update 7 (Negative):
I figured out why I've been having issues. Turns out the geniuses at DICE and EA are even more incompetent that I could have ever imagined. I'm playing on a laptop, with a RTX2070 and an integrated graphics as part of the CPU. And yup, you guessed it, the game runs on the integrated graphics, and worst of all, even if I disable the integrated graphics so that only my RTX2070 is available, the game decides to run WITHOUT A FUCKING GPU, so I basically get 5 FPS in the menu. How is this possible? Only a corporation as incompetent as EA and DICE could have such a pathetic and nonsensical issue. And I'm far from the only one experiencing this issue. Good job guys, even when you're doing good, you somehow find a way to fuck it all up!

Update 6 (Negative):
ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING ME!?!?!?!?!?! Everything was great, I was enjoying the game and having a load of fun. I play in servers with about 100ms ping, and it's been fine. But ever since the new season (specifically when the game became free on Xbox pass) it's been unplayable. Even with just 100ms ping, the game is rubber banding in this weird way where the game speeds up and slows down on loop. This has been happening for weeks and has gotten worse! I can't believe this game has taken such a step back.

Update 5 (Positive):
I can finally recommend this game again! I've been having an absolute blast in portal hardcore modes. Most of the issues I previously described have been mostly fixed. There are still severe stability issues that need to be addressed, but the game has been steadily improving. I still hate EA and DICE for launching an unfinished game, but credit where credit is due, I'm having a blast playing it. I hope the devs keep up the good work, there is still much to be fixed and features to be added but I believe this game is a diamond in the rough, a future gem!

Update 4 (Negative):
The lack of a proper server browser is proving to be very frustrating. The new content and map reworks have been a welcome addition to the game. Certainly helps make the game more fun. DICE are on the right track but not quite there yet.

Update 3 (Negative):
DICE has made huge progress. Still a buggy piece of shit that runs like crap. But at least it's a fun piece of shit.

Update 2 (Negative):
Still fucking sucks. They've made some progress but I think the game is fundamentally bad even if DICE fixes all the issues it will still not be a "good" battlefield game. I realized this after going back to BF4, a game that was also broken on launch. The difference is that it suffered technical issues not game design flaws like this pile of crap. RIP battlefield series. 

Update 1 (Negative):
How disappointing, the more I played this game, the more things fell apart. I won't bore you with a list of issues since countless players have already done that. The final straw was the game suddenly running like crap on my system, even after a clean restart, pinning my CPU at 100% while only using "50%".

I WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER BATTLEFIELD GAME UNTIL 2042 IS FIXED! Until then my confidence and trust in this series is broken

Jesus where do I start with this game. Can I recommend it? With how Live Service works. No.. No I just cant. We are getting into the 6th Season (which after a few patches I can once again play) and I just cant see EA supporting the Title much longer. As someone who Pre-Ordered the game in hopes of "The Next Battlefield" seeing the the turmoil of Dice as a Studio, EA as a Publisher ( Was the Latter really a Shocker) it just highlighted in bold the problems with not just this game but Live Service as a whole. Its a model that demands your time and takes time from more casual games (What little is left without a BP anymore) and as someone who doesnt sit on one game it just gets old. I dont like a forever grind for the new content and im too old school to just "buy my way to the top" 

The Pros:
- Its a totally different game from Launch. Just short of a Destiny Taken King type Turn Around if only they didnt die on the hill that is Operators. But Classes are back, the Weapons feel good, The maps play alright given the circumstances and reworks.

- Dice as a Studio has once again come into their own and are competent with the Game Engine, This entire studio kind of flipped on its Head with Senior staff leaving for greener pastures. It was a painful walk through a confused and muddled vision of "what the game should be" between bugs, feature delays, season delays, and the infamous Operator system

- Its a good looking game, weapons and environments are nice to look at. The overall gunplay feels more relaxed but still rewards more perceptive/reactive players, Plenty of UI communication tools, A scoreboard (finally) and in game Voice/ Text chats (both. finally.) for communication 

- Theres a healthier balance between Classes & Operators & the Newer Maps play much better. Overall there is a lot more of a team dynamic in games with the rework to operators the introduction of a sub class system within them. People are actually playing Medic yay! The old maps are clunky and a poorly suited for what the Franchise generally holds in store (BF4 Level-ution anyone) and in general play pretty poorly with how open they are alone. Some maps have been reworked but it still feels a little too open in certain spaces

The Cons

- Its an EA game. Enough said

- Playlists are lacking, and theres very little focus on the other modes with Hazard Zone removing features simply to populate lobbies rather than address issues to make it stand out as another way to play (I liked the raid style loadout and economy systems in a more casual game its a bummer it went away) while Portal seemed more setup to become a crutch for a lacking Dev Playlist. Mostly generic or repeat servers serving only to grind XP rather than mix and match the Eras of BF have become the norm. Making 2/3 gamemodes seem like a lot of un-needed bulk taking from the core experience

- You never know what update is going to break the game for you. It started with S2 bugs but has followed down the line into S6 and the random choice to switch from Easy Anti Cheat to EA Anti Cheat which basically broke installs across the board. Same like when they Moved everything over to the EA App and phased out Origin. If its not the Game its EA Play disconnecting and refusing to work normally. The Invisible Hardware bug still plagues the game to the point Ive played a few hours since S6 dropped. In reguards to S2 everything was so broken you couldnt tell it was a AAA Game Studio. 

Overall. Its fun. its become my go to casual shooter in a world plagued by grindy BPs and generic Battle Royales. I havent paid for a Season Pass out of my own pocket since I got mine in S3 and Its kept me playing enough to finish all those Passes and rebuy the next with what you earn from the Pass. But with how Live Service works I cant recommend a game that is this "old" even if its gotten a new season recently. Its got issues but its been a complete turn around from Day 1 and in comparison to Games like Call of Duty with the MW3 DLC/Reboot/WZ Tutorial and Halo Infinite with its greedy begging for money to fund itself with cosmetics despite MS being worth billions. Gaming today sucks. Dust of the PS2/Xbox OG or ps3/360 and play the classics

I bought it for 12$ and I'm so happy I did. Don't get me wrong, you can have fun with the game, especially with friends. But there are just so many bugs still present to this day it's insulting.

- Black screen of death every 2-3 games, only option to resolve is to alt+f4 and restart the game
- Crashes happening from time to time
- Textures not loading properly
- Parachute bug : When you are on the floor sprinting, sometimes your character will "fall" for .5 seconds and the game thinks you're in the air so it deploys the parachute
- Recently they had a mouse bug where the mouse would just not respond in the game for a good 5 seconds and your character would stutter. They fixed this one quick as the game was unplayable, but each update a new one will appear.
- Can't bind/unbind as you wish and if you somehow manage to do it in the game folders, it will reset it next time.

And many more...

The gunsmith system and customisation is almost non-existent. It's very basic and every gun has the same attachments. But you can bet your ass you have 100 of cosmetics available. The stats of every gun also means nothings... Firepower of 60? Ok but the gun does 22 damage per bullet so what is firepower? AM40 has 30 of firepower but does more damage than the m5 that has 50 firepower, so what now?

Destruction has been downgraded. It was a fun mechanic in other BF games, but in this one there isn't a lot of it (remember the Shanghai tower in BF4?).

Specialists is also another bad thing. I'm sure they made it to appeal to the COD audience and to sell skins for your so cool over the top specialist. Except they are unbalanced and doesn't fit in a BF game; everyone looks the fucking same also instead of 2 armies facing each other.

If it is on sale and you wanna have some fun with friends for 2 weeks, go for it. That's what we did and we got bored and frustrated of it quick.

-You can safely pass this game without feeling you missed out on anything fun, but if you feel you absolutely MUST play it, or you had your fill of Battlefield V, pick it up during a sale, as it unfortunately still isn't worth full price just yet.
This game has its moments of fun then your admiring the skyline and you die from a sniper that is 1,000 mm away. FUN GAME THO!

What may have launched as a disapoint has gradually over time turned into a solid FPS title.  The classic feel of older Battlefield games has been restored with the latest patches and the game has turned around. I can now recommend this game and feel good about the recommendation.
better than mwiii
